campaign.story:
In this cooperative arena combat board game for 1-4 players set in an open world, it’s not you who dictates the flow of battle, but the monster you hunt — and every monster is wildly different.
Pick your hunter based on their unique weapon and playstyle. Select which iconic monster you’ll be hunting across the wilds. Track the beast in a choose-your-own-adventure quest, avoiding pitfalls and gathering bonus resources. Then plunge into adrenaline-fuelled combat where teamwork, positioning, and stamina are key, targeting the loot you need for the weapons you want — without getting crushed!
The more monsters you slay, the better the weapons you can craft, the bigger the monsters you can hunt
These massive beasts will roll, bite, body slam, spit poison, submerge you in sludge, and even charge across the board to pin you in a corner, pushing your party members out of the way and forcing everyone to reposition in the process.
Hunt down more information about: Great Sword, Dual Blades, Bow, Sword & Shield
Hunt down more information about: Great Jagras, Tobi-Kadachi, Anjanath, Rathalos
Hunt down information on: Charge Blade, Switch Axe, Insect Glaive, Heavy Bowgun
Hunt down information on: Barroth, Pukei-Pukei, Jyuratados, Diablos, Black Diablos
 Hunt down more information about: Kulu-Ya-Ku
Hunt down more information on: Long Sword Hunter, Hammer Hunter, Gunlance Hunter, Light Bowgun Hunter, Lance Hunter, Hunting Horn Hunter
Keep an eye on the updates. Information on the rest of the Hunter's Arsenal hunters will come during the campaign!
Hunt down more information on: Kushala Daora Expansion, Teostra Expansion, Nergigante Expansion
This campaign won’t feature stretch goals that are unlocked once you reach a certain funding level. Instead, every day, we’ll automatically unlock an extra "Login Bonus" reward that will be added to every Core and All-In Pledge for free!
Hunt down more information about: Great Sword Alt Sculpt, Great Jagras Palico, Azure Rathalos Cards & Quests, Bow Hunter Alt Sculpt, Anjanath Palico, Alt Sculpt Dual Blades and Sword & Shield, Rathalos Palico, Tobi-Kadachi Palico, Starting Armour Hunters, Poogie, Black Diablos Cards & Quests
Keep an eye on the updates. Information on Login Bonuses will come during the campaign!
The Elder Dragon and Hunter’s Arsenal expansions are already included in the All-in Pledge, and can be added on to any pledge as optional buys.

It’s time to journey to an uncharted land, because the Astera basecamp needs YOU.
Become a hunter of the Fifth Fleet to track down and slay the fearsome monsters roaming the New World. Protect basecamp and craft awesome new equipment with the loot collected from your fallen foes, so you can take on bigger and badder beasts!
Battle massive monsters in a wild open world.
With two complete core sets, playable standalone or together, you can embark on quests in two distinct habitats teeming with native beasts. 
As you gain more experience, the monsters get tougher. Every beast has three difficulty levels to challenge your skills. Successfully slay a 4-star monster, and you’ll win your campaign!
Want a one-shot monster fight without the tracking? 
Arena quests let you hunt any monster, at any difficulty level, using any hunters, right away. Simply equip your hunters with the recommended loadout and dive headfirst into the fight!
Explore the lush Ancient Forest...

...the arid Wildspire Waste...
...or combine sets to expand your world!
Play with any combination of hunters and hunt any combination of monsters during your campaign. Because hunters can make equipment from other sets, combining sets opens up a whole new world of weapons and armour for your hunters to craft.
Find out how the core sets combine


Because hunters are defined by their weapons, every hunter is a different way to play. Where the great sword hunter trades movement for raw strength, commanding respect with its incredible stopping power, the dual blades hunter favours swift strikes and mobility — dashing in with a flurry of blows before dodging to safety.
Some video game weapons come with extra special features, like the charge blade and insect glaive. To really squeeze the juice from that Divineapple in the board game, those hunters come with special rules.
The monsters you hunt will determine which loot you earn and what weapons you can craft to help on your next quest. So, you’ll need to decide together where to follow the Scoutflies next. 
Once you’ve chosen a monster, track them through the lush Ancient Forest or arid Wildspire Waste using the choose-your-own-adventure quest book.
Immerse yourself in the New World, gathering resources, avoiding health-sapping pitfalls, and searching for a monster that could appear at any moment.
Just like in the video game, the tabletop monsters can be wild and unpredictable, with changing moods and attack preferences. The tracks you discover will determine what state you find the monster in, and which special attack is added to their deck.
Enjoy the beauty of the landscape as you climb trees, scale cliffs, and explore caves for bonus resources — but don’t get too distracted. Every quest has a time limit. As you hunt, you’ll discard time cards, giving you less time to take down the beast when you eventually track it down...
Discover more about the Gathering Phase
It’s crush-or-be-crushed with monsters as mobile as these! Every monster is a boss, and every boss is a unique challenge, with different ways of moving, different attack styles, and special rules that will trigger during battle to change things up.
Monsters dictate the flow of battle, deciding who to target and even taking the first turn.
Luckily, the more experience you gain, the better you’ll get at predicting the monster’s next move. As you learn their ‘tells’, the clues on the back of every behaviour card will give you a bigger hint at what’s coming next.
Once the monster has made their move, it’s your chance to react! Because these are wild beasts you’re fighting, you won’t always have the same opportunity to act before the monster moves again. 
You’ll need to decide who’s best placed to attack, who needs to sharpen their weapon, and who needs to get the heck out of the way before the beast strikes again...
Discover more on Monster Behaviour
Your position matters. Monsters have four arcs for their behaviours and their body parts: front, left, right, and rear. Where you’re standing determines whether you’ll get hit, but also what parts you can target.
Breaking parts can trigger rules that change monster behaviour and earn bonus loot for your whole party, which you can use to craft upgraded weapons for taking on tougher beasts.
When you’re taking on a monster, three things are vital to success: positioning, teamwork, and managing your cards.
There are no dice in combat. Instead, combat is controlled by cards which you’ll use to create combos, meaning you’ll string together attacks at the cost of stamina.
Because attack cards can also be used for movement and dodging attacks, which also uses stamina slots, you’ll need to make strategic choices about when to play cards and when to keep your board clear.
Keep an eye on your stamina to balance your offensive and defensive moves, or you might find yourself caught out and crushed by a massive monster attack!
Discover more on How Hunters Work
 Craft new weapons and armour upgrades using the hard-won loot from your monster battles, swapping cards into your deck to gain newer (and more powerful!) bonuses and attacks.
Checking potential rewards is key to choosing your next monster quest. Some equipment offers elemental damage and resistance which could help you in a future hunt.
Because everything you craft stays in your inventory, switch equipment between quests to give you the best chance against the next beast!
You’ll start with a unique attack deck based on your hunter’s weapon and upgrade options you can craft from bone and ore. The more monster loot you claim, the better your weapon choices become!
Discover more on Upgrading Your Hunter
Like the video game, Monster Hunter World: The Board Game is a campaign game. Over multiple sessions, you’ll face tougher monsters, upgrading your hunter and equipment as you go.
The more monsters you slay, the better the weapons you can craft, the bigger the monsters you can hunt — until you’re ready to take on a 4-star monster and win your campaign!
With 25 campaign days to spend (more if you're playing with combined sets), you'll need to make strategic choices about which monster to hunt and when. 
Will you hunt tougher versions of the same monster to craft all the weapons you can? Or try a fresh challenge?
After a heart-pounding hunt, you may want to kick back and relax. Spend a few campaign days at HQ visiting the Smithy to craft new equipment, petting the Poogie, and enjoying a meal whipped up by the Meowscular Chef!

Spirit Swap: Lofi Beats to Match-3 To is an action-puzzle game set in a lush, narrative-driven world of witchy demons. Cast spells, be queer, & crash the biggest concert of the year!
By night, use Samar’s powers to help send transdimensional spirits back home. By day, roam the city and chat with friends, planning the ultimate pizza party for everyone to come together and catch up.
 Match to the beat as you reassemble lost spirits, and enjoy a custom lofi soundtrack by the incredible Meltycanon.
 Cast powerful spells. Arrange spirits into special patterns to unlock potent powers!
 Compete in local VS mode! Everything is chill, until it gets permanently unchill....
 Enjoy over 5 unique game modes, including Time Attack, Score Attack, and Survival.
 Bond with a cast of witches and demons. Plan a pizza party together, crash a concert, maybe even smooch in our extensive Story Mode!
 Decorate your bedroom. Earn trinkets and keepsakes as you play, then place them in Samar’s room to affect the game!
 No microtransactions here. Spirit Swap is a premium game, which means you'll be able to enjoy it without worrying about hidden costs.
 Queer and diverse joy. Much like the cast of Spirit Swap, our team is also is queer, Black, and/or POC, and it's well past time we see ourselves experiencing happiness in media. This is a slice-of-life story for players needing a relaxing experience!
 A fresh look at Middle Eastern fantasy by creators FROM the region. Spirit Swap is set in a fictional city inspired by the Levant, a region rarely explored (in a positive light) in games.
Samar - the main character!
Mo + Leon - the coolest people you know with soft centers.
the Polycule - these hot people are all dating wow
Pookie - giant teddy bear and BFF4LIFE
There are few things Ishk loves more than carb loading at Lulu's bakery, but maybe there’s something other than pastries that keeps him coming back around.
AND MORE CHARACTERS THAT WE'LL INTRODUCE AS THE CAMPAIGN PROGRESSES!
 NEW CHARACTER REVEAL: KANON

who ARE they????
 Match-3 action meets visual novel storytelling in Spirit Swap!
Inspired by Panel de Pon, Spirit Swap lets you use a keyboard or controller to move spirits into groups of three or more to help reassemble their forms, and send them back to their proper dimension. Throughout the game, you’ll improve your magical abilities and learn new spells by exploring the world and talking to your friends.
Story Mode progresses through various areas of the city, cleaning up different “hot spots” where transdimensional spirits have accidentally crossed over.
Outside of Story Mode, there will be additional game modes -- Time Attack and Score Attack will be available for those up for the challenge. For anyone wanting a chill experience (perhaps to help wind down for the evening), Endless Mode will be available as well!
Bhyg Mode will also be available! It's a local-versus mode where you can compete with up to seven other friends (eight players total) on a wonderfully chaotic shared board!
There’s more to life than work, though, and Samar and their friends will have opportunities to hang out, chat, and bond! Depending on who you visit and when, you’ll be able to develop a deeper relationship; plan a pizza party together, go to a concert… maybe even smooch! 
As Samar’s bonds with her friends grow deeper you’ll unlock unique dialogue, spells, and items. You’ll also be able to decorate Samar’s bedroom using those trinkets and keepsakes, and each of these will provide different boons to your match-3 strategy, in addition to making Samar’s room feel like home!
Spirit Swap’s world is inspired by the devs’ love for their Lebanese roots, lo-fi and wired technology, and the 90’s colorful aesthetic with a sprinkle of demonic vaporwave.
Samar is a young witch working the spirit-swapping night shift in the eastern outskirts of Demashq. A recent spike in spirits crossing over from another dimension breaks the chill atmosphere of their night shift. With her trusty FamiliarZ by her side, she sets off into the city to find out what’s happened. With the popular band, 5SOME, scheduled to kick off their big comeback tour in Demashq, Samar needs to work quickly before the city is overrun with stans and spirits alike....not to mention, they've got a pizza party to plan, and romance to pursue!
Spirit Swap takes place in Demashq, a coastal city inspired by the Levantine cities of our own world, Damascus and Beirut.
The game follows Samar as they make their way from their home right outside the city, by the nearby forest, into the sprawling coastal city of Demashq where they meet their friends.
one of Samar's possible paths through Demashq
It reflects the Levant’s general topography, nature, architecture and climate (middle eastern Mediterranean) as well as cultural references, vibrancy, and visual cues.
A setting seldom explored in games outside the lens of orientalism, and almost never by people from that part of the world themselves.
Spirit Swap’s in-world magic draws on two main things: plants and community. Plants and nature are the source of all magic and humans when banded together act as amplifiers and users. The world is one parallel to ours where plant magic was democratized around the turn of the millenia instead of wireless communication. Magic and tech have become deeply intertwined.
In a world where magic is at everyone’s fingertips, everyone needs a helping hand. For witches and demons alike, Familiars serve that purpose.
In the past, summoning a Familiar was a lengthy process.  Charting the constellations, preparing the ritual, and massive energy drain directly following the manifestation of an individual’s soul became less popular in modern times.  Yet, the need for a Familiar’s assistance and companionship did not.
FamiliarZ Concept Art
FamiliarZ were created to solve the problem; tech-assisted miniature devices that allow anyone to manifest a Familiar without the expense of magical energy required to sustain it.  With casings ranging from fashionable keychains to portable cassette players, witches and demons choose personalized ways to interact with their Familiar without having to reveal to the public any aspect of their inner selves.
FamiliarZ Concept Art

We have been working on this title for 8 months now, and have made great progress: this funding will allow us to dive even further into making Spirit Swap the game we’d love it to be.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
With the expertise of our team, having been a part of 11 shipped titles and various facets of the game industry, we are confident Spirit Swap is happening, one way or another!

What this Kickstarter campaign will do is help determine just how far we can go with this title. Our hope is that this campaign can give us the financial boost to add content, potentially bring it to consoles, and make sure it’s polished so that the final Spirit Swap experience is an incredible one. We’ve also partnered with Dual Wield Studio -- the merch partner for other games like Among Us and Best Friends Forever -- to ensure experience and support for physical reward deliveries.

Even with significant experience and preparation, game development can be unpredictable and delays are always a possibility. If the game feels unfinished, we prefer to continue working on it and delay its release until we are confident that you will enjoy the result! Thank you!

campaign.story:
Astor and friends hand-made eco-adventure! (Animated gif)
Discover a colorful sandbox open-world where you can farm wondrous plants, craft tools and shelter, harness the elements, and shape the land around you.

Play your own way - be clever, be creative or even be mischievous. Befriend strange beasts, dodge dangerous surprises, gather resources, and explore unique biomes to uncover the Secret of the TerraBeast.
Astor gifts a Mighty Beast their favorite treat.
You play as an Astor, a special OddFauna, whose biological imperative is to seek out TerraSeeds. You will have to form a symbiotic bond with your living world, your TerraBeast to discover the TerraSeed's location. Will you seek out the TerraSeed? That is up to you. 
The world is filled with OddFauna for you to meet.  Chat with them and get to know them. Give them their favorite treats to show you care. Earn their trust and you will receive items, recipes, or maybe even a new party member. Befriending a beast boosts your abilities and making a true friend will grant you a wearable pin which unlocks a new ability.
Many Beasts are friendly... if you know how to interact with them. Entice them with a special treat, help them to build a shelter, or even ask them to join you on an adventure!
Beware the beasts that come out at night! And watch out for the ones that may hide in bushes.


Tiny and gentle, the Sproutling help tend to the Terrabeast and are vital to a thriving ecosystem.
Transform your TerraBeast into your own adventure paradise. Your Terraform ability allows you to sculpt the ground like clay. Shape the landscape to fit your adventuring needs; create rivers and lakes to play in, raise mountains to gain a better view or create fields to farm your favorite treats. 
Sculpt the Landscape like Clay!
Go even further and alter the temperature, soil quality, and water level of biomes. Create a frozen desert, flooded forest, or arid grasslands.

Your choices have an impact on the other OddFauna. Ovoks love forests, Logurs need lots of water, and Trico's love it hot! Create a new habitat and new OddFauna will migrate and create a cozy home for themselves. 
Your growing ability allows you to craft astounding plants.  You have control over how they are shaped which grants you the freedom to use them for shelter, food, infrastructure, or just their beauty. 
Each crop has a season in which it can be grown. You will need a crop strategy to ensure that you have enough food and resources for the whole year. Being prepared for the start of the growing season will give you a head start on exploring!

Create your own unique flora by combining different seeds. Cross-pollinate to yield more fruit, improve quality, or to change the color of your plants.
Handfuls of berries, huge delicious fruit, yummy earth roots, and many more!
Gather and grow resources and craft them into handy items for your adventures.  Craft tools, sandbox toys, shelters, and accessories to adorn yourself.
Building a shelter not only replenishes your energy, but it also protects you from the creatures that lurk in the dark.
Everything in the world abides by the rules of nature. You can interact with everything you see in the world. Burn with fire or replenish with water, it is your choice. Experiment with different combinations of elements to make new discoveries.
Burn with fire & freeze with ice
Every action you take has an impact on the world. It is up to you to decide how to treat your world. You may choose to go on a fire-wielding rampage and burn down entire biomes. If you want to remedy your actions, you'll have to get your paws dirty and plant a new forest.

Allowing your TerraBeast to become unhealthy will present some tough challenges. Blight will begin to appear, spread, and destroy everything it touches. As weather events intensify, you’ll face lightning super storms, raging wildfires, and choking sandstorms, just to name a few!
A healthy TerraBeast will grow larger each season. This unlocks new areas for you to explore. New OddFauna, biomes, and crops will become available as the world grows larger. The outer rings of a fully mature TerraBeast have been known to be home to Legendary Beasts.
Astor, Trico & Mo are off to explore a newly grown forest.
Your home, a giant majestic TerraBeast
Your world is a massive living beast, called a TerraBeast. They have a very long lifespan. It's rumored they can live for millennia. Their backs are covered with a thick coat of organic material. It's a fertile land, an ideal place for life to take root. It's common for TerraBeast's organic carapace to form blight and attract unhealthy creatures. They rely upon Astors to help keep them healthy. It is unknown how TerraBeasts spawn-- it's believed that Astors may play a role.

The world of the Terrabeast is procedurally generated and will be different each time you begin a new adventure. As the world grows, your actions help to shape it. If you maintain a healthy TerraBeast, the new biomes that grow will be fertile and healthy. Do you want to create more forests? Plant lots of trees and new biomes will be forests too.

The world is divided into different biome types, Grasslands, Forest, Mountains, Desert, and many more! Each Biome attracts different OddFauna and has specific needs to remain healthy. 
OddFauna thrive in their favorite biomes.


Game Development Plan
The game is currently in Pre-Alpha and being developed for PC and will be released on Steam as an Early Access Game. (Wishlist Today!) Early Access will allow us to get it into player hands, get their feedback and have the time to use that feedback to shape the game. We are looking to our community of players to help us make the game as awesome as it can be. 

We are making Alpha & Beta Access available as reward tiers. If you want to get your paws on the game as early as possible back at those levels! Alpha and Beta members have access to special discord servers that we will be reaching out to for feedback. Alpha and Beta backers will be able to vote on certain game decisions and help steer the development of the game.

If the Kickstarter gets funded, it will allow us to port the game to the Nintendo Switch! We will be able to buy Switch dev kits and ensure the game will perform amazingly on the console. I am incredibly excited at the prospect of developing for my favorite console. It will be a lot of work, but with your support, we will make it happen. OddFauna promises to be amazing on Switch! The Switch version of the game is available as an add-on item and with an estimated delivery date of Q1 2023.
We are a husband and wife team. Emma is the Creative mastermind behind OddFauna. She has been creating the cast of characters for years now. A few years ago we started talking more and more about how great a video game would be in her world. Last year, Cliff quit his AAA game development job to make it a reality! We finally are able to expand this awesome universe, and it is such a privilege to get to partner together on this creative journey.
Our little family
Everything in the game is hand-sculpted by Emma. This gives the world a very unique style. They are then hand-painted by Emma and handed off to Cliff. Cliff Photoscans them cleans up the models. The animation style and the hand-crafted nature of the models gives the world a stop-motion type of feel, which we love.
Check out our updates for more on our process!!!
How a character gets created.
We've been developing OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast full-time now for a year, self-funding the project entirely with our life savings. For 2 people we have come a long way in a short amount of time. We are approximately 50% of the way through development. While we've made a lot of progress, there is still a lot of work to do. In order to continue to work and retain creative control, we need to ask for your help. We’re also hoping to build a community of passionate backers who want to be involved with the process of development. With your help, we believe we can build the best version of OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast that we possibly can!

"OddFauna is such a unique and beautifully handcrafted game, made by an indie developer who actively engages with their audience!" - Tiny Tay (Discord)
The vast majority of our budget goes directly into making the gameplay amazing, the visuals beautiful, and the sound gorgeous. We will expand to get assistance with the music and audio and be able to hire help for community management, QA, and marketing.

OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast is a true passion project of ours, and we've made a lot of financial sacrifices to get this far. We'll finish the game at a smaller scale even if this Kickstarter isn't funded, but the game will be bigger and better if we meet our fundraising goals!

Exclusive TerraBeast Hard Enamel Pin
A limited edition colorway exclusive to the Kickstarter. This hefty little friend measures 2" wide in hard enamel with shiny gold metal. We’re working with Alchemy Pins, whose products are beautifully made, with a very high attention to detail.

Exclusive TerraBeast Bandana
22" 100% cotton bandana with Emma's original TerraBeast design. Ice dyed and screen printed right here in Seattle by Ink Knife Press. Because of the nature of the dye, each one will be unique, making them extra special!


Exclusive "Ride" Collector Statue.
Designed by Emma, produced by Level 52 Studios. This limited edition high end collectible is a Kickstarter Exclusive.  3D scanned from Emma’s original sculptures, these statues will measure 8" and will be cast in Polystone. Packaged in a collectors box, they will come numbered and signed, with a certificate of authenticity.

Surprise Creature Painting!
These are original creature concept painting by Emma. Each piece measures 5x7 (or larger) and is painted in watercolor and ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. Each piece will come signed with the name of the creature on the back. There are only 30 different character paintings up for grabs and they will be shipped out blind box style. Which one will you get?
"Flying Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed, Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Flying Friends

"Adventuring Friends" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x16 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper. 
Adventuring Friends

 "Together" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Together
"Astor and TerraBeast" Original Concept Art Painting by Emma SanCartier
12x17 : Signed. Watercolor & Ink on hot press cotton rag archival paper.
Astor and TerraBeast

Custom Legendary Beast Sculpture
Do you want an absolutely original OddFauna sculpture? Choose a few key features of the beast of your dreams, and Emma will do the rest. She will take your idea and turn it into a beautiful (or terrifying) art sculpture that will be the envy of all your beast loving friends! Sculpture can measure up to 11" and can have the same level of detail and complexity as the Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast seen here.
Legendary Beasts - Kelpie and Hoarfrost Beast

Our Environmental Commitment
As we grow, we plan on donating and partnering with different organizations that are working towards rebuilding healthy ecosystems. Our first step is partnering with Eden Reforestation Projects. They hire local communities to plant a variety of native tree species in deforested areas. We will plant 1 tree per copy of the game sold.


Video BG Music : "5 minutes pleasure" by Hiroki Kikuta. Licensed under CC 4.0
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are an experienced team, and we understand many of the risks we face. Here are our plans to deal with these risks.

Financial risk: We are confident that this amount of funding will allow us to deliver a solid game that meets our goals. We have put a great deal of our own funds into the development so far. It was important to us to put our own money into the project first and get the game to a solid place before reaching out for support. We will continue to fund the game if the Kickstarter is not successful, but it will not be as big and polished as we are hoping.

Schedule risk: Our timeline is short, especially with only two of us working on the game. We have been meticulous about keeping the game in scope. To make sure we hit our goal, we have a roadmap that extends beyond shipping. A successful Kickstarter will allow us to hire experts to help in areas like music, community management, etc. This will allow us to focus on what we do best: making the game.

Gameplay : With just two people it can be challenging to make any game. Proper scope, experience, and passion is the key. With your support we will make OddFauna: Secret of the TerraBeast an amazing experience. We are very excited to continue this adventure with you!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
PRITTY - On a scorching summer day at a community pool, a black teen learns to step out of his comfort zone, and with the help of a charming neighborhood boy, overcomes his fear of the deep end. 


Savannah, GA (early 2000’s)  backdrops this naturalistic coming-of-age story. The Deep South breeds its black boys hard, then there’s JAY. He sticks out for all the wrong reasons. He’s dark-skinned, quiet and skinny; and likes to wear flowers in his hair.
The opposite of his masculine and charismatic older brother, JACOB. Their differences peak at the community pool where swaggering manhood is on full display. Jay is reserved as he struggles to embody his brother’s carefree confidence.
Until he gets help from JUSTIN, a charming, light-skinned boy from the neighborhood. Their new friendship is tested, however, when an unspoken truth dares to surface.


Terrance Daye, photographed by Alexy Kim
My name is Terrance Daye, the director of Pritty: The Animation. In 2019 I completed -Ship: A Visual Poem, an award-winning short film that significantly impacted my film career. For all of its success, however, I felt dissatisfied with filmmaking. Every day, the world seemed to grow more hateful and unjust. I asked myself, “What is the point of art-making if we’re all saying the same things and nothing is changing?”
Then I remembered a 300-page unpublished manuscript by the name of Pritty that was shared with me by a close friend and soon-to-be collaborator: Keith F. Miller, Jr. I remember being floored by the audacity of Keith’s words. His complex depiction of black men coming of age was the very hope I now needed.
There are too few stories that simply feature black boys at play, discovering their full humanity and vulnerability—and learning to heal because of it. I longed for my own work to engage more intentionally in this practice. I changed my perspective on filmmaking and committed to bringing a new question to the big screen: “What would it mean to visualize the softer, more intimate sides of black men without fear of consequence?”
With renewed vision and a devoted team by my side, I set about bringing Pritty to life. Visualizing this world and now getting to animate it has given me permission to hope again. It has been one of the highlights of my year and has taught me that filmmaking is just another form of dreaming. The world may be chaotic now. But it won’t always be. Black lives may exist on the cusp of constant peril now. But somewhere there must be joy and laughter. The media can’t imagine this for us. But we can imagine it for ourselves. Can’t we?



We originally planned to make Pritty as a live-action short film, but when our shoot got canceled due to COVID-19 we weren’t ready to give up. Through animation, we found a new way to bring Pritty to life!
Animation is a medium that is full of imagination and dreaming, and with Pritty, we are actively allowing ourselves to imagine what it looks like for black and brown boys to be free. Choosing to make animation our new medium felt like a natural fit to capture these dreams, hopes, and imaginations for our future world.
We turned to Japanese animation director, Hayao Miyazaki, to inspire the lush landscapes and naturalism that we wanted to exude through Pritty. His work became one of our largest sources of inspiration. But for all its beauty, we never saw ourselves represented in his worlds. Bring Hayao Miyazaki To The Hood became our new motto. Our hoods, our communities, our spaces with their subtleties and nuances are worthy of occupying the center. This animation is a reminder of that.
Our animation direction includes lush, romantic landscapes, textured ambient sounds, and distinctly black character designs that create a sense of immersive realism through traditional 2D Animation - an immersive Black reality that we rarely see depicted in animation.
We are partnering with Powerhouse Animation Studios in TX for our animation production. Powerhouse Animation Studios is a full-service creative agency that we are very excited to have bring our rough animatic to life and later, with your help, our full animated short! 

Character Designs from Pritty: The Animation


 Writer/Director - Terrance Daye 
Terrance Daye - Photographed by Alexey Kim & Illustration by Jarren Simmons
Terrance Daye is an award-winning poet and filmmaker from Long Island, New York. His creative work reimagines traditional representations of black masculinity and male identity and invests strongly in destigmatizing mental illness within the black community. Terrance received his Bachelor’s degree from Morehouse College and his Master’s in Fine Arts in filmmaking at NYU Tisch School of the Arts. Terrance is a two-time Spike Lee Production Fund recipient, a 2018 Sundance Ignite Fellow, the recipient of the 2020 NewFest Film Festival Emerging Black LGBTQ+ Filmmaker Award and the 2020 Outfest Film Festival Programming Award for Emerging Talent. His most recent film project -Ship: A Visual Poem was awarded a Short Film Jury Award for U.S. Fiction at the 2020 Sundance Film Festival. Terrance is currently developing his original hour-long drama, Mandingo, with the 2020 Sundance Episodic Labs. 

Executive Producer & Author of Pritty: The Novel - Keith F. Miller, Jr. 
Keith F. Miller, Jr. - Photographed by Alexey Kim & Illustration by Jarren Simmons
Keith F. Miller, Jr. is an award-winning educator, storyteller, artist-researcher, and village-builder/raiser with nearly 10 years of experience in education, spearheading youth arts, leadership, social justice, and community engagement initiatives. Additionally, he is the managing editor and creative director of The Pillow Talk Project, a rapidly growing blog and social movement dedicated to sharing the fearless stories of men--and those who love them--redefining masculinity and rediscovering the healing power of everyday intimate conversations.
Committed to supporting the healing, growth, and thriving of boys and young men of color through trauma through narrative change, creative community development, and everyday intimate conversations as activism, Keith travels the country as a National Writing Project Teaching Consultant, a National Afterschool Matters Fellow, and a Forward Promise Fellow for Leaders through the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation. He also serves as the Executive Producer for the short film, Pritty, based on his unpublished manuscript by the same name.

 Producer - Jeremy Truong 
Jeremy Truong - Photographed by Alexey Kim & Illustration by Jarren Simmons
Jeremy Truong is a San Francisco transplant working as an LGBT film producer in New York. Attracted to films with socially impactful themes, Jeremy hopes to move the needle on timely and urgent issues by exploring them in subversive ways on screen. His work has screened all over the world including the Sundance Film Festival, SXSW, BFI London, and the Tribeca Film Festival. His first feature film, ‘Cicada’ was acquired for distribution after a 2020 festival circuit and is currently in development on another feature length LGBT film. Founder of bicoastal production company, ‘rubbertape’, Jeremy is graduate of NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts and is an SFFILM Rainin Grant Recipient.

 Producer - Natalie Jasmine Harris 
Natalie Jasmine Harris - Photographed by Murugi Thande & Illustration by Jarren Simmons
Natalie Jasmine Harris is a filmmaker from Maryland.  As a producer, she is dedicated to uplifting underrepresented narratives about people of color, womxn, and LGBTQ communities. Natalie received her BFA from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts in May 2020, where she graduated with Honors and received her department's award for Excellence in Community Service. Passionate about the intersections between filmmaking and social justice, Natalie worked for Elizabeth Warren’s Presidential Campaign in 2019 as a Video Intern and recently created a short documentary in collaboration with TIME Magazine and the Biden/Harris campaign. Over the years, she has produced films that have received recognition from The Directors Guild of America, Sundance Ignite, Outfest, Vimeo Staff Pick, Short of the Week, The British Film Institute, and The National Film Festival for Talented Youth (NFFTY).


In pivoting from a live-action short film to animation, we realized that our budget would increase exponentially. However, we believe that the black kids we create this art for are worth the time, the money, and the big asks.
In this Kickstarter campaign, we will spend 31 days trying to raise enough funds to reach our first goal of $50,000 and then strive to get as close to our $1.6M budget as possible. While $50,000 is our initial target, we hope to hit our 6 other stretch goals that will allow us to continue the animation process. Each step is vital in getting the film as beautiful, polished, and professional as we imagine it can be; whether that be through this campaign or as we partner with production companies and animation studios to close the gap.
It’s incredibly important that we remain transparent, so we created an outline below to show you exactly where your hard-earned money will go. We're hoping production will begin with Powerhouse Animation Studios in August 2021 and for the animation to be completed by October 2022.

 "When Black Boys Feel They Heal" - Keith F. Miller, Author of Pritty the novel & Executive Producer of Pritty: The Animation 
Today, few animated queer coming-of-age stories exist for black men. Pritty aims to fill this gap and expand a necessary conversation around what it means to be a black boy coming-of-age in America.
Pritty is a universal but unique story of one teenage boy’s journey through pain and trauma to transformative self-acceptance and healing. It purposely flips the typical narrative arc that audiences have come to expect from queer films where the boy gets bullied and either succumbs or survives. And, instead, pushes against what we’ve been conditioned to consider possible...arriving on the other side of healing, hope, and community.
This story was created in response to a startling, ever-present truth: boys and young men of color face innumerable obstacles that prevent them from living long, full, healthy, and productive, emotionally-rich lives. And more than anything these obstacles stand to block young men from feeling.
We believe there is a correlation between the limited range of queer black male representation on screen and the staggering number of suicide attempts amongst black male LGBTQ+ youth.
Unfortunately, most black queer coming-of-age films habitually reproduce traumas onscreen without visualizing futures beyond the “coming out” experience.
Pritty aims to address this disparity by showcasing black men in an unconventional light. Instead of watching black boys fight, belittle and harm one another; we get to watch them at play, figuring themselves out, making themselves vulnerable and healing in the process.
Visualizing a world where black boys get to express themselves without consequence models an alternative reality for queer black youth, which present-day narratives don’t even allow them to imagine.

Our Pritty universe includes this animated short film, but also goes beyond it to include Keith's forthcoming novel, a live-action feature film adaptation (soon to come), and so much more that we can't wait to show you!

Risks and challenges
Our producing team has been working on Pritty for over a year now. We believe that we are well-equipped to handle anything that comes our way - especially after we pivoted to animation during the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. However, our biggest challenge with the project is that animation is a new endeavor for many of us. This is why we are collaborating with our partners at Powerhouse Animation Studios. We are confident that Powerhouse will be able to manage the workflow of this film because we have already collaborated with them on the teaser animatic (which you can watch in our campaign video). We believe in Powerhouse's creative ability and we have already established a workflow and positive relationship with them. We don't anticipate any major challenges, but should the unexpected pop-up, we'll be sure to communicate any issues or delays with you right away.

updates.update_content:
There are times in our lives when we feel lonely and left to fend for ourselves. But since we launched this Kickstarter on March 1st, we were reminded by over 3,200 people that stories like Pritty: The Animation not only matter but they are needed for all of us to heal.
On behalf of the Pritty team and all the people we made this for, we will be able to do this because of and for you. Thank you for joining us on this journey and we look forward to sharing other updates with you along the way as we celebrate the path of Pritty: The Animation to the big screen.

This Kickstarter will officially come to an end in ~90minutes at 4:10 pm EST today. We’ve had such an incredible run so far! Any last RTs, shares, and donations would mean the world! Thank you, thank you, thank you!
-- Team Pritty

With just 24 hours to go on our Kickstarter, we're delighted to share that we've officially surpassed $100k towards Pritty: The Animation! Before the end of our campaign (4/1 at 4pm EST), we ask that you join us in making one final push in support of Pritty! 
If all 3,000 of you increased your pledge by $10 OR encouraged a friend to donate $10 in the next 24 hours, we would have enough money to secure our voiceover cast, fully animate our rough animatic, and add color to the animation for So please keep spreading the word and shouting "Pritty: The Animation" from the rooftops!

We're almost to the finish line!
There are just 3 more days left of our Kickstarter campaign for Pritty! This whole journey has been an incredible blessing to us all! We honestly can't say thank you enough for showing up and supporting us this far! 
Please keep spreading the word and encouraging your loved ones to help us as we bring to life! Every dollar truly counts as we near the end of our campaign. Let's finish strong! April 1st, here we come!

We are so delighted that our Pritty family now has over 2,000 beautiful backers from all over the world! With just 7 days left of our Kickstarter campaign, we're working towards our stretch goal of $120k so that Pritty can truly finish strong! We hope that you can join us in continuing to spread the word before April 1st!
As our Director, Terrance Daye said in our last update: "Please continue to share and shout Pritty: The Animation from the rooftops. Because now more than ever, the world is listening!"

THANK YOU! 
Our hearts are so full! To celebrate us reaching our first goal of $50,000, below is a special note from our Director, Terrance Daye & Author of Pritty: The Novel, Keith F. Miller Jr.

We have officially surpassed 1,000 backers on Kickstarter! 
Thank you so much for joining our Pritty family😊 We are so incredibly grateful for all of your support thus far & we can't wait to grow even more!
Much love!

WE ARE OVERJOYED!

We raised over $17,000 (now over $23,000) 🤯

campaign.story:
Before you start reading, please press play to enjoy an immersive medley from our game soundtrack.
"Being plucked into A Long Journey to an Uncertain End’s little family of spacefaring nerds felt like being wrapped in a warm blanket." - Fanbyte
"It sounds out of this world." - Gamesradar
"[The game] is dripping with style: it’s like a 1980s Saturday morning cartoon spawned a strategy game for people who enjoy character drama, drag queens, and space." - The Next Web
"The cast of characters are immediately loveable, and a lot of care has gone into creating an inclusive gaming experience." - The Digital Fix
"In A Long Journey to an Uncertain End, the future is queer, strange, and beautiful." - Gayming Mag
"Never in my life did I expect to see that level of representation, much less in a video game." - Six One Indie
 Fuel was running low. Truly tapped the gauge with an idle digit, like its caress might inspire the needle to swing higher.
The problem was time. Time, and distance. Your pilot spun in their chair, thumbing down the system map. Three planets within reach, each promising jobs, supplies and opportunities. But there was no time. Or was there?
Like an answer to their question, a notification: New Message Received. You knew who had sent it, knew what it said. You saw your pilot crack a grin and angle their face to the nearest camera.
“Choice is yours, chief. Where to next?”
We’re Crispy Creative, a diverse indie studio of veteran game devs and industry newcomers alike!
Between us we’ve worked at some of the most exciting studios in gaming, from Obsidian to Telltale Games, and on titles including The Outer Worlds, Batman: The Enemy Within, the upcoming Kena: Bridge of Spirits, and more!
Now we’re ready to strike out on our own and bring our brand new universe to the world.
We’ve been working on our new project for a while now, and are super proud to be launching the Kickstarter for our game A Long Journey to an Uncertain End.
Below you’ll get an overview of the game itself, a feel for the characters and world and some insight into what we’re hoping to achieve on this project. If you like what you see, we hope you’ll join us on our journey to make our ideas a reality!
A Long Journey to an Uncertain End is a narrative-focused space opera that’ll have you flying around the universe, assembling an unruly crew from an eclectic cast of characters, and taking any job you can to keep one step ahead of your abusive Ex. The twist: you’re not just piloting a ship…you are the ship.
Every planet, moon and space station is a valuable source of jobs and precious rewards. Assign crew tasks based on their skills, and help their decisions along the way. If everything pays off you’ll have what you need to escape, and if not...well, you can call in those favors you’ve been saving.
Fly across a unique galaxy, from the dust-bitten badlands of the Rim, to the techno-industrial megacities of the Core…and Beyond.
Recruit an eclectic crew from a diverse cast of characters with their own stories and varied skill sets.
Explore planets, moons and space stations as you put distance between you and your abusive ex. Match your crew to jobs and decide their actions along the way. If all else fails, you can always rely on a favor or two.
Manage your resources to keep your crew happy. Boosting between worlds can take its toll, as can failing at jobs. A happy crew is a productive crew… most of the time.
Every crew member has a skill they excel in. And every job has a recommended skill! Line up the right crew with the right job (or don't) to see what the outcomes might be.
Even if you don't have the perfect skill, having skills that are adjacent, or even opposite can still yield interesting results. And sometimes the most interesting outcomes aren't the most obvious.
Get to know your crew and they'll reveal hidden talents and expertise that might help you in a pinch. You'll also need to pay attention to the situation and the local giving you the job. They may not always be who they appear...
Make the right choices though and you can earn some favors to use elsewhere. Get into a pinch on the massive urban world of Matu? That shady trader from Spacer's Folly still owes you one! That grateful wildebug rancher's family ties may stretch further than you think. Best keep an eye out as there are hidden helpers throughout the galaxy...
It's not all planet-hopping and job-doing though! Crew need supplies and you need fuel and repairs to stay in tip top shape. Your Ex is always in pursuit so keep an eye on how many days till they catch up!

The Cast
The Ex
(CW: abusive relationship)
Due to the immense cognitive fortitude and variety of knowledge required, only a fraction of a fraction of the universe's population could even dream of becoming A.I. Therapist. Unfortunately for you, one of them is currently on your trail - your Ex. Relentless and unwilling to stop until you're back in their care, your ex will expend every resource at their disposal to ensure your return.
C.O.R.G.I.
If you're the captain, then C.O.R.G.I. is your first mate - your Comprehensive Operational Responsive Graphical Interface. While not really a dog in the old-fashioned sense of the word, C.O.R.G.I. does have all the characteristics of zeir organic counterparts: loyal, trusting, and always with your best interest in mind - the rest of the crew being a close second.
Aylah Tress 
Throughout her travels across the 'verse, Aylah has arguably lost more than she ever gained. Luckily, neither age nor travel has dulled her wit, compassion, and disdain of authority. She still believes in the unity of machines and humanity, and keeps the crew and the ship together - either with a sturdy wrench, a stern talking to, or in some instances, both.
Denholm (Denny) Welker
After life handed him a sack of lemons, Denny came to the conclusion that the best way to survive was his way - one of subterfuge and guile. Turns out he was pretty good at it too, spending his formative years developing his skills without getting bogged down with concepts like "personal property" or "petty theft". Lemonade will only get you so far.
Matias Vidala
After an accident during his short-lived career as drag persona “Gloria Borealis” (involving a pyrotechnic “comet tail”, several audience members, and third degree burns), the flamboyant Matias may or may not be on the run and/or doing a revival tour. Although sugary-sweet most of the time, Matias can be quick to sour...
Truly Dashum
Truly is one of their system's youngest pilots, and an ace at that. Quietly intense with a subtle flirty streak, Truly is a romantic at heart, collecting small items from their travels to decorate their outfit with.
Zera (Zeke) Hakkimirez
With her extra set of bionic arms, Zera, or Zeke as she prefers, is a cyclone of prepping, measuring, and cooking in the galley. Her upbeat demeanor and genuine compassion for others inspires her to speak  truest language of love: food.
 Set thousands of years in the future, in a universe where space flight is mundane, A Long Journey to an Uncertain End takes place in the aftermath of explosive expansion and technological marvel.
When Artificial Intelligence blossomed into sentience, the ensuing symbiosis of humankind and machines allowed for galaxies to be charted and planets terraformed - but sentience came at a cost. It led to A.I. becoming aware of their own existence and purpose, and after horrifying conflicts between creators and creations, an era of prohibition. Machines were expected to return to subservience - a school of thought made manifest by the study and practice of A.I. Therapy.
Earth is but a distant memory to most - "home" no longer refers to a single planet, but a shared universe. It's a time of unity and diversity, with humans from all corners of all galaxies coming together for peace and progress. You, however, as well as your rebellion and escape, still feel the chilling shadow of mistrust sowed centuries ago.
Tumbleweeds bounce over a burnished plateau, the ground here a crust that shimmers in the heat. All is silent...until it isn’t.
The new sound begins as a feeling in the gut. Louder it comes, dust rising in a tsunami as the sunlight retreats behind the descending shadow. With a scream, landing gear extends from the incoming vessel and slowly, gently, kisses the ground.
Touchdown.
A ramp extends and deposits three figures onto the plain. One looks about, head swivelling like a predator on the hunt.
“Great...another skuzzhole.”

A Long Journey wears its inspirations on its sleeve: proudly. Our mission was to meld the vast imagination of French illustrator Moebius to the vibrant sci-fi operas of TV series Firefly and the works of author Becky Chambers.
We wanted to create a universe full of the familiar and the unexpected, to put new twists on old formulas and create something truly unique. Whether you're exploring the backwater worlds of the Rim or the megacities of the Core, we’ve done our best to create worlds that are engaging, exciting and new.
  The Crispy Crew
 Up to this point we’ve been completely self-funded; working on the game when we can to promote a healthy environment for the whole team. We've gotten to the point where we're ready to work on the game full-time!
With your help we can devote all our energies to quickly finishing development and shipping the game!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Game development is inherently risky. Despite all of our experience and planning, unforeseen events may still cause schedules to be adjusted or rewards to be delayed.

All that said, this is not our first (or second...or third) game. We've released titles before. We've already prototyped and implemented all of the core gameplay features, as well as worked through our production pipelines.

The biggest risk to the timeline is expanding our scope based on user feedback or polishing features more than anticipated. In either case, any delays should mean the gaming experience ends up being bigger and better than we originally planned.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
I wish to take a moment to acknowledge I stand in solidarity with all those across the world protesting against the violence which police forces perpetrate against vulnerable communities, particularly Black, Trans, and Indigenous peoples who are regularly the victims of systemic oppression.
---
Want to break into a heavily guarded bank to steal a mafia leader's diamonds with your coworkers, but only have an hour free on your lunch break?
Compelled to haul illegal goods across the vast expanse of the united galaxies while avoiding the Intergalactic Police, but too intimidated to learn a whole new complex set of rules to do it?
Ever wanted to delve deep into the tombs of Aa'tagon Ruu and slay the ancient dragon guarding its vast treasures, but you're someplace where rolling dice and breaking out the character sheets is a bit too cumbersome?
Then Runt is the system for you!
Runt is an 8-page rules-light and story-driven tabletop roleplaying system designed for 2+ players. It features simple, freeform mechanics which are easy to internalize, allowing a greater focus on the story, world and experience and less fiddling with complex rules or remembering intricate systems. It also requires no materials to play: no dice, no character sheets, no cards, nothing! This allows a game of Runt to be portable and be played whenever you're in the mood for a game. 
It's designed for one shots and short campaigns, but there's no reason it can't be used to host long term experiences with either. Additionally it's a genre and setting agnostic system, so you can play whatever experience you want to explore wherever you want it to happen!
1) Genre Agnostic!
Runt is designed to enable the Host (the player running the game) to run a game in any setting or genre. Science fiction, fantasy, true crime, romance and anything else you can think of!It aims not to lock the player to a certain style, tone or theme, but rather lay out simple mechanics and mindset which you can utilize to play whatever style of story you want to experience.
2) Simple Mechanics!
Runt's conflict resolution mechanics are designed to be simple and intuitive. They can be internalized and executed on quickly, even for new players. It achieves this with a resolution mechanic called "Challenges" which allow conflict to occur but doesn't require players to overthink the situation - just resolve the Challenge quickly and flavourfully and move on!
This helps everyone not only get into the game quicker, but to avoid the barriers which may come with learning new systems for new worlds to play in. No need to remember rules around firearm ranges, learning the conditions of a spell, figure out who makes a move and when, or other intimidating mechanics required by some roleplaying games.
3) Material Free Experience!
The basic Runt rules requires no additional peripherals to play the game. This means no writing utensils, no character sheets, and no dice. So long as you have one person Hosting a game and a least one other person to to play it, you can play a game of Runt. 
While some sort of tracking tool (paper, notes app, etc.) is usually a good idea for keeping track of details over longer campaigns, in many cases it isn't even required!
The Runt Guidebook is a 10 page black and white, printable .pdf that contains all the rules players need to know for running a game in the Runt system, such as:
 Consent Systems - an introduction on how to keep Runt fun for everyone
 Character Creation - including rules for equipment and Unique Abilities your character may have
 Rules on "Challenges" - a step-by-step walkthrough of Runt's simple resolution mechanic
 "How To Host" - a quick primer on how to get in the mindset of Hosting a game in the Runt system
Runt is already design-complete and tested! It only requires art and a bit of final proofing before it can be sent to you. 
To that end, I'm partnering with Toronto-based artist Brennan McNamara who is already creating the art to make Runt's pages even more beautiful!
The funding from this campaign will primarily be going towards paying for him to create art for the guidebook, as well as reimbursing me for the labour involved in creating Runt!
 NOTE: ALL STRETCH GOALS WILL BE INCLUDED WITH EVERY TIER OF RUNT!
$400 [GOAL REACHED]- Printable One-Page .pdf with all the rules on one handy sheet!
$600 [GOAL REACHED]- Character Sheets templates; templates to track your character details and keep tabs on your wonderful companions!
We've hit all the stretch goals and won't be adding any more to keep the project simple. Thanks to everyone who has supported Runt so far :)
---
 Click HERE to join the Runt Discord where I'll be sharing some updates and developments as the project unfolds, as well as where you can ask me any questions you might have about Runt!
I'll still be sharing information on the Kickstarter page and I'm reachable over Twitter at @Devon_Wiersma if Discord isn't your style!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
No bones about it: this is my first time running a Kickstarter campaign AND my first time publishing a tabletop RPG, so I am new to the process. However, I have extensive experience in digital game development so I know the risks inherent to production and scope as well! That's why I'm keeping the project small and manageable, as well as keeping all deliverables in electronic .PDF format to avoid any troubles that could have come from dealing with physical distribution. 

Runt is also *design complete* and only needs a proper art treatment - this means as long as this campaign reaches its goal there really should be no hiccups delivering it to you once the campaign meets its goal!

campaign.story:
Thank you for joining us at our Developer Commentary Livestream. Watch the recording here.
All additional scheduled livestreams have been postponed until further notice. We will post an update when we select new dates.
GOAL UNLOCKED: Join us for our Developer Retrospective Livestream (Before/After, Alpha to Release). (Date postponed, TBA)
 GOAL UNLOCKED: Join us for our We should talk. Seminar by Carol & Jordan. (Date postponed, TBA)
It's not what you say, it's how you say it. We should talk is a short-form narrative game that will make you think carefully about the words you choose, coming Summer 2020 to Windows, Mac, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. 
In We should talk, you'll use the sentence spinner to piece together modular sentences in response to the in-game characters. Choose your words carefully to express yourself as you discuss ongoing problems about life and romance with Sam, your in-game partner, over text messages, while also chatting with friends and strangers at your favorite local bar.
The combination of words you choose impacts the conversations you have, how genuinely you can connect with your partner, and whether your relationship can survive the night. It's up to you how to respond—depending on how you communicate, you'll see one of 9 possible endings. 
Personalized Choices: Using the sentence spinner, make choices that connect with you. Countless options abound—be yourself, or role play someone you never thought you could be.
Unique Characters: Your night at the bar is more interesting thanks to all the unique people you encounter. Find your healthy balance between chatting with your friends and keeping up with the texts from your partner at home. 
Different Paths: Your choices drastically affect the way folks respond to you, leading to one of many different paths in each conversation. Will you be accommodating, flirty, stand-offish, or somewhere in-between?
Multiple endings: Play again and again to find all 9 possible endings. Conclusions aren't based on a specific path or route the way many traditional narrative games branch, but instead the endings are based on the tone your responses express throughout the game. What do your relationships look like at the end of the night?
Realistic conversations: Experience the emotions that come with real conversations, whether it’s the the joy that comes with teasing a friend, the anxiety that comes with a heavy text message, or the frustration of navigating a touchy conversation with a creep. Express yourself as clearly as you can and hope that your conversational partner understands, though there's always a risk they might interpret your words differently than you intended.
The development of We should talk is close to completion, so we're turning to Kickstarter to help our launch be as strong as possible. Our team hoped to present We should talk at a number of global events this spring and summer as we near the game's release, but the pandemic threw a wrench in our plans. We're raising money to help us pay for marketing and promotional efforts post-launch so that we can try to reach more people through digital media. We know this project is important and deserves to be seen by folks who would benefit from its message, and we feel that Kickstarter is the best way to help us make that happen. We plan to use the money we raise to help us advertise through social media, sponsorship, and other available marketing avenues. 
Francesca, Carol, Jordan & Nobonita
We should talk was created by Nobonita Bhowmik, Francesca Carletto-Leon, Jordan Jones-Brewster, Carol Mertz, Kat Aguiar, and Jack Schlesinger—six developers that met as MFA students at the NYU Game Center. Our team came together with the goal of creating a game that challenges traditional transactional romance in games, and collaborated to push relationship-building games forward by expanding the realm of player choice. While the game started with all of us together in Brooklyn, NY, our team members now span as far globally as Bangladesh, Japan, St. Louis, MO, and Madison, WI.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The development of We should talk is finished! The game is already in the process of certification and approval for consoles, and available to wishlist on Steam, with a pre-approved build. That said, there are very few risks at this point in development, other than a potential delay in our release due to COVID-19 and other economic and industry roadblocks.

We are offering some Kickstarter tiers that allow Backers to contribute content to the game, and do know that can often be a source of delay. We won't allow backer-written content and credits to delay us unnecessarily, and plan to enforce strict deadlines on reward surveys so that we can get credits and content in the Steam version of the game in time for our anticipated summer launch.

Weaving Tides is a charming singleplayer adventure set in a world of magic and textile. Ride on the backs of carpet dragons and explore a stunning textile landscape, as you soar above and dive below the weave.
Call your Weaver and set out on a journey to explore ancient dungeons, solve puzzles, challenge quirky creatures and unravel the great mysteries of a long forgotten past!
Dive into an enchanting, woven world and reveal secret pathways.
 Stitch and cut your way through the textile landscape and wrap up your foes using your Weaver's unique stitching abilities.
Solve tricky textile puzzles which are scattered across the world.
Conquer Zelda-like dungeons but beware of their fearsome guardians!
Befriend three different Weavers, choose the one that fits your playstyle.
Outfit your Weavers with mystic embroideries to enhance their abilities.
Uncover hidden mysteries packed in a charming story.
Prologue Download
Weaving Tides will be available in seven languages: English, German, Russian, French, Spanish, Japanese and Simplified Chinese.  
We will also keep our ears open to your requests. If there is enough  interest we will do our best to translate Weaving Tides to even more  languages.
Some of our biggest influences: The Legend of Zelda Series, Bastion & Tearaway
Weaving Tides is influenced by a cluster of our combined interests and the things we love, but among our greatest inspirations are the Legend of Zelda series, Bastion and Tearaway. Our takeaways from these games are:
An epic adventure filled with challenges like in the Legend of Zelda  
A beautifully crafted story and lush, vivid environments like in Bastion 
Creative Puzzles and witty interactions with your surroundings like in Tearaway 
All of the mechanics in Weaving Tides are inspired by textile crafting techniques. The Weaver dragon you ride has a “ribbon tail” that flows behind it as you fly. It serves a variety of purposes and is the key to completing the challenges of the woven world.
Using the Weaver's ribbon allows you to complete magical stitching patterns, pull down hovering chests, drag heavy rugs, pull open curtains and more. 
Sometimes the solution lies hidden somewhere close by, other times you will have to explore the mechanics of the puzzle further in order to solve it. Use your imagination and puzzle-solving skills to overcome these challenges and advance on your journey.
The world is filled with secrets and optional puzzles. Find them and your curiosity will be rewarded with new clues revealing the mysteries of the world or useful new items.
While the primary focus of Weaving Tides lies in the narrative, as well as puzzles and exploration, it also offers laid-back, fun combat mechanics. 
 Every enemy will require you to adopt a different strategy in order to defeat it.   
 While, for example, the Toothy Yappers have to be flipped onto their backs by resurfacing right beneath them or dashing through them… 
  ...the moles have to be pulled out of their dens before you can stitch or dash them.
The combat in Weaving Tides is challenging, but not overwhelming.  If it turns out to be too easy for you, you will be delighted by the various opt-in modifiers in forms of items which will toughen up your foes.  
Once you’ve mastered these skills, explore dungeons to put them to the test! We have three dungeons waiting for you: a forgotten desert temple, a mind tangling forest maze and a dangerous lair which has yet to be unveiled!
And of course at the end of each dungeon a boss is waiting for you! 
Experience a sprawling, strange new world full of adventure and secrets. In this world Tass seems to be the only one of his kind - a human. Accompanied by his foster dad Kilim he sets out to solve the mysteries of his past. But the world he calls home is changing in dark, unexpected ways, and a force that once lay dormant beneath the weave is awakening. 
 Weaving Tides is a tale about finding a sense of belonging. The story is told in a light-hearted way sprinkled with charming characters and witty puns, but at its core it is a rich and emotional narrative about family, identity and the blurred lines of morality.
 Travel across the four unique layers of the woven world. Each layer has it’s own culture, aesthetic, puzzles and dangers. This strange world is inhabited by intelligent beings called "the Mothkin", moth people with human-like features and a predominantly friendly nature. 
Explore the sun-drenched dunes of the Silken Desert, home to small nomadic villages such as your hometown, Veteri.
Lush, dense & dangerous, the Spun Forests are home to the tribal Mothkin who are strict believers of the great mother Dea.
The Mothkin empire is a stronghold of trade and culture. Blessed by a moderate climate the Mothkin of the empire express their love for their land by growing beautiful, well-trimmed gardens.
Some speak of barren landscapes ravaged by relentless storms and hidden deep beneath the lustrous cities of the empire. Unknown things lurk down there; all we know for certain is they mean us no good.
The Weavers are the guardians of the woven world. Even though most Weavers are loners, three of them will join you in your quest and will invite you to ride on their backs. 
Each one of the Weavers behaves slightly different. While Twill has a higher movement speed, Luce can take more hits, for example - but their greatest difference lies in their special stitching abilities. It is up to you to use the Weaver best suited to your current situation, or you could just use whichever Weaver you like best!
Kilim's special move allows him to cover a wide area, perfect for patching up large rips and slowing down groups of enemies.
Twill spits her ribbon in a straight line and can therefore precisely remove single threats without having to move into dangerous zones herself. 
When Luce’s special move is unleashed he rushes forward, stitching and cutting everything in his path. Great for breaking through walls of enemies; not so great at avoiding painful obstacles. 
Although you will find some items by simply exploring the world and uncovering secret areas, some of the most sought after ones can only be bought from Salis the flying merchant.  
You gain Thread Essence by patching up tears in the world and by unsealing chests. Use the essence to buy magical embroidered patches which will greatly help you on your journey.
A small selection of the magical emroideries you will find on your journey.
Some of the items will be opt-in modifiers for folks that want an extra challenge: to give the enemies, say, more health in exchange for larger rewards. 
 Sometimes a Mothkin will entrust you with a letter to a loved one, other times you might find a ripped scroll of parchment stuck between the branches of a terry-tree. Collect these writings if you wish to delve deeper into the lore and mysteries of the woven world.
Capable explorers will find ways to reach even the most remote areas of the woven world. There you will find enchanted ribbons which can be used exclusively in Playground mode. Collect them all to create a stunning masterpiece of digital embroidery!
Weaving Tides' Playgrounds mode invites you to create your own digital artwork. In this mode you can choose from a variety of ribbons, including those you unlocked in Adventure mode. There are also some helpful special features:
different camera positions allow perfect framing for your fancywork
you can toggle the cutting functionality of the dash ability on or off
load in custom transparent background images to trace with your stitches
take a snapshot of your finished work by using the built-in camera
 The only limit is your imagination! Combine different ribbon styles to create mesmerizing patterns or pay tribute to your favorite game characters by reimagining them through weave. 
These are just a few of the main characters and along your journey you will receive the help of a wide range of peculiar allies.
Weaving Tides’ evocative musical score, sound effects and overall audio will be handled by our talented composers Timo Jagersberger & Frank Schlick. Time and time again they have put us in awe with their rich and emotional music, but describing it with words won’t do it justice so we will let these tracks speak for themselves: 
What is an Add-on?
You can customise your Reward Tier by choosing items to add and increasing your initial pledge by the necessary amount.
How do add-ons work?
Press the "Manage your pledge" button on the very top of this page.
  Shipping is already included in the add-on prices. Choose the EU price if your shipping address is part of the European Union. Choose the Int. price for anywhere else in the world.
  Increase your pledge in the "Pledge amount" by the amount needed to claim the add-on(s).
   Save your pledge.
  After the campaign, we will send you a survey asking which add-ons you want.
  Hi we’re Follow the Feathers - a small independent games studio from Austria!
We strive to create enchanting worlds and love to come up with unusual game mechanics. Prior to this project we made NIVA, a game where you play as a mighty forest god that can grow or wither plants. We also worked on a bunch of smaller projects, but Weaving Tides is our most ambitious project to date.
Thanks to the Kickstarter community creative, niche projects like this can exist. Weaving Tides began as a small idea about exploring a woven world but as development went forward the project grew and so did our passion for it. 
We want to make Weaving Tides a game that you will love as much as we do and that is why we want to involve you in the process of bringing it to life! We’re going to be especially interested in your ideas and feedback on:
Progression & Balancing
New items
Puzzle design
Weaving Tides has been in development for almost two years now. We have come all this way thanks to our close circle of friends, the support we received from the Vienna Business Agency as well as our own funds and efforts, but for this final spurt we need your help. The funds from Kickstarter will enable us to pour even more polish and love into the game and make Weaving Tides what we know it can be.
  This is how funds will roughly be split up:
After Kickstarter fees, taxes and fulfilling the Kickstarter rewards all funds will go directly towards the development costs of Weaving Tides, localization as well as paying our composers to whip up even more amazing tracks. 
About 75% of the game is done. The core of the game is fully finished and all levels except the ending are fully playable. What remains is a lot of gameplay polish, more art assets, scriptwriting for minor characters and bug squashing. We are therefore confident that we will be able to deliver Weaving Tides in late autumn 2020.
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have been developing Weaving Tides for more than two years. Most of the difficult work is done and throughout our past five years of working together as a tight-knit team we have learned how to tackle even the most daunting tasks. We give our estimates a lot of thought and factor in technical hurdles as well as polishing, therefore we are confident with the timeline we have laid out. 
Of course no one can predict the future and there is always a chance of unexpected problems to occur which will potentionally delay the project. However even if such a case arises we will finish Weaving Tides without compromise. 
Making Weaving Tides the best it can be is our main priority and we will always keep you in the loop about the current status of the project. Thank you for your faith and support!
