campaign.story:
Derby Drama is a tabletop role-playing game about skating in a roller derby bout! In each one-shot game, players split up into two teams of competing skaters. Explore relationships with teammates and rivals, choose smart strategies, and play your most skillful moves to help your team win.
I designed Derby Drama because I used to play roller derby, and I really miss it! This sport literally changed my life. But playing roller derby is also expensive, a huge time commitment, and physically dangerous. It's not accessible to me right now. So I wondered, what if I could evoke the feeling of roller derby... just by playing a tabletop game with friends? 
Since then I've playtested Derby Drama with dozens of folks at meet-ups, PAX Unplugged, and Metatopia, improving the rules with the feedback these lovely generous players have given. I've even played the game with my old teammates from Ohio Valley Roller Girls. Now I can't wait to share it with you!!
Derby Drama is primarily a set of zines: The Bout (the rules), Holler Derby (a modern-day flat-track roller derby setting), and World-Wide Roller League (a 1970s banked-track roller derby setting). The zines will be photocopied in black ink on light colored paper, folded and stapled by hand.
The Rules 
An early preview of the zine- colors aren't final
The Bout is 36 pages of detailed instructions for play, facilitation, world-building, and safety, written to be easy to pick up and play for 2 to 3 hour one-shots.
The Settings  
Me (second from the left) blocking in a co-ed bout in Marietta, Ohio
Holler Derby describes a fictional roller derby league in Appalachian Ohio. The 16-page booklet includes NPCs and locations, with lots of fun tables to roll on for character backstories, motivations, and relationships. As well as describing a specific setting, this booklet also gives folks unfamiliar with derby a general idea of what a modern-day flat-track roller derby league is like.
World-Wide Roller League is a fictional early 1970's roller derby production inspired by the real-life Roller Derby and Roller Games. Co-ed teams travel from city to city to put on theatrical banked-track productions to entertain crowds of spectators in arenas as well as a home television audience. Players can join in on the over-the-top action with special rules inspired by Nathan D. Paoletta's World Wide Wrestling. 
 Stress tokens are any small token that represent the energy of the bout. You can use beads or coins, but if you support the project at the Power Jam level, you'll get 25 lightning bolt stress tokens for your game. You'll also get an eco-friendly reusable scoreboard and team cards.
Prototype scoreboard and team cards plus stress tokens
Derby Drama will come with two reference cards (one for blockers, one for jammers) full of real-life flat-track roller derby moves. One side of each card lists Offense moves and the other lists Defense moves. Learn how to Eat the Baby to stop the opposing jammer  or Jump the Apex to score points!  
 Derby Drama is a single-session game that takes between one and four hours to play, depending mostly on the number of players.
The game works best with two to six players and an equal number of players on each team. Usually the facilitator of the session plays a skater in the bout. If playing on a team would make the teams uneven, the facilitator can take on more of a game master role, describing scenes and acting as other characters in the bout.
Game play is organized into alternating phases of interpersonal drama and intense strategic sports action. Each jam, use your athletic prowess and skating skills to dominate on the track. Before the bout and between jams, gain advantages for teammates and inconvenience the opposition. Take your team to victory... or at least look really cool in front of your crush.
How to Play
Each player chooses to play a Jammer or a Blocker. They create a derby name and look for their character, as well as assigning numbers to four stats: AGILITY, POWER, DRAMA, and HEART.
Just like a real roller derby bout, Derby Drama is broken up into two periods, each having multiple jams.
During a jam, each team rolls the Team Dice that will determine the score. Then players decide (secretly) on a specific strategy or play.  Next, each player reveals their strategy. A good offensive result can allow your own team to re-roll a low score to gain more points. A good defensive result can force the opposing team to re-roll a high score. A failed strategy can lead to a penalty, costing your team points.
 When all the players have played out their strategies, that's the end of the jam - the Team Dice totals are added to the Scoreboard. The team with the highest score at the end of six jams will win the game-within-the-game. But winning isn't everything, and every character has their own reasons for playing.
Between jams and at halftime, players can role-play how they are feeling about the bout, their teammates, and their rivals. They can try to gain advantage for their own team by Boosting Morale, or disadvantage the opposing team by Stirring Up Drama. Friendship, romance, revenge, and straight-up cheating are all on the table. However - schemes can backfire. If your bout has a Meltdown, everything spirals out of control, and who knows what could happen?
 The illustration of skaters in the header is by the very talented Kaylee Rowena! 
The zines are full of illustrations drawn from Intuitive Capturing Studios' catalog of thousands of photographs of women's flat-track roller derby bouts. I've hand-picked dozens of photos and carefully retouched each image so they'll look beautiful when reproduced in black-and-white.
Thanks to everyone's support I've been able to bring on a few wonderful artists to help with the project. Gum (Instagram) will make stickers of cool roller skaters! You'll be able to add these to your pledge when you pay shipping. Michelle S.B. (Instagram) and Alex "Lorena Vomit" Wright (Instagram) are going to illustrate imaginative roller derby bout settings and characters!
Since we were able to raise $2,500, West Virginia artist and designer Liz Pavlovic will illustrate and lay out the Holler Derby setting zine. Liz is a super talented designer with a style that is perfect for this zine and I'm so excited to work with them!
If at least 250 people order the print zine, worker-owned, union print-shop Radix Media will print the zine. They use high-quality, environmentally-friendly paper and equipment and make incredibly beautiful printed works.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've never done a Kickstarter before and I've heard many tales of woe about the fulfillment process! So I'm most worried about that and I have spent a lot of time researching how to handle it. This is why the more time-intensive levels are limited.

The game itself is pretty much done and playtested. The settings zines still need layout and art and that could take longer than expected.

Hi everyone, I sent out the "smoke test" survey to a small percentage of backers yesterday to make sure that the survey isn't too confusing or broken. updates.update_userinfo: Video from single-player playtest & sticker art preview
updates.update_content:
Hi friends, thanks everyone for your amazing patience. I'm feeling way better now and I've been back to work, working with the artists and playtesting and polishing the game. 
If you'd like to hear all the details, join the Discord server. This week, I'm actually running a playtest of a different game there - Fight with Spirit, a game by Storybrewers. I've wanted to try a roller derby setting for Fight With Spirit since I played it last year, and on Thursday we're going to give it a shot! I'll think it'll be very inspiring to try out a different take on a sports game and I hope we can give Storybrewers some helpful feedback! That game is filled up already but to hear about future games.

updates.update_content: Hi everyone, just want to share an update since it's been way too long. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic, my mood and productivity have tanked to the point where I haven't been able to work on the game. I'm going to concentrate on healing my brain so I can get back to finishing the game soon. I'll let y'all know once I'm making progress again and update you then on the timeline for getting the copies to your doors and inboxes.

campaign.story:
"Raw, bloody, tough, and not the slightest bit concerned with civility." -- Rock, Paper, Shotgun 
"Wild, melancholy, funny, and willing to take absolutely none of your shit." -- Wired 
"Defined as much by its rough edges as by its moments of brilliance." -- Paste Magazine
EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: BOUND BY ASH is the second season of the primary story in the EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER universe. In it, you play as the gay disasters Cass, Brad, Sam, and Lianna, beating up neonazis, hunting cryptids, and making plenty of bad decisions along the way on their quest to steal the sun. 
Play Season One: Powered By Blood NOW at:  
 $23,000 - EXTENDED SOUNDTRACK [!!!REACHED!!!] 
The EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: BOUND BY ASH soundtrack gets two bonus songs, enhancing the audio landscape of the game!
 $24,000 - BONUS PAY [!!!REACHED!!!] 
Each collaborator on the project gets an equitable split of this bonus pay! This doesn't come with direct rewards for y'all, but it'll allow all collaborators on the project to spend more time making it as good as it can be!
 $25,000 - CUSTOM EPISODE TITLE ART [!!!REACHED!!!] 
All six episodes will come with custom episode title art, each by a different artist!
$26,000 - EXTENDED POSTCARD PACK [!!!REACHED!!!]
If reached, this tier will extend the postcard set all $50+ backers will receive, showing visions of the lands of Rust, Sath, Cali, and the mysterious M.F!
$36,000 - ROAD TRIP ANTHOLOGY
EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: ROAD TRIP ANTHOLOGY is a multi-episode look into the other regions of Meatworld in full visual novel format. Each episode is written by a different author as they give their own take on the bizarre and bloody landscape and the people who live there, from the surreal bloodswamps of the Fleshlands, to the ghostlands of Tornado Valley, to the sentient hateful forests of the Pacific Northeast.
You play as Sam, Cass, Brad, and Lianna, four antifascist mech pilots on the move. After a disastrous event which cost the lives of thousands, your small group is hurled directly into the middle of a massive conspiracy where even the sky isn't the limit. 
With the clock ticking before the next disaster, you must band together and fight, sweet-talk, and jam your way across the treacherous Rozarx, piloting mechs, killing fascists, and hunting cryptids to pull off the greatest heist of all time.
We're gonna steal the motherfucking sun.
The combat in Meatpunks is kinetic, gnarly, and bloody. In each combat scenario, you play as one of the four main characters, each with their own specific abilities, moves, and animations, as you scratch, juke, and teleport through endless hordes of fascists.
Additionally, we're implementing a new HEART CHANGE system -- when a character has an especially big moment of growth in the story, it comes with a completely new move set for the combat sections! A character who's weak now may have a breakthrough that changes them to the strongest character in the game, or a strong character could become weak.
SAMAEL GODKILLER (he/him): An absolute sweetheart hiding a terrible secret, Sam used to be a farmer before being run out of town and finding solace in the Meatpunks. He tries his best to appear normal to not worry his friends, but if you look closely... He has two shadows.

CASSANDRA TRANG (they/them): The group's reluctant leader, Cass puts most of their effort into just trying to get through the day. At night, eerily prescient nightmares give them a glimpse of the horrible future. They're almost certain their guidance has gotten good people killed. 

BRADLEY ULTRABRAD (he/him): Always quick with a joke or an inscrutable reference, Brad is the group's resident mech engineer. He's got a heart made of meat, and he's always willing to talk about his newest mech designs! He's been a little quiet lately, though... I wonder what's up with that.

LIANNA CARNAGE (she/her): Lianna made her first kill when she was twelve, and has caused a lot of damage to a lot of bad people since. She's pretty cheerful about it, too. Now that she's back in her home state, though, it looks like that first kill is coming back to haunt her.

THE TRUCKER (she/her): A new friend and potential tagalong for the group, The Trucker is looking to make one last delivery. She's quick with sarcasm and quicker with a right hook. She and Lianna seem to be getting along suspiciously well...

Heather Flowers (she/her) - Designer, writer, producer 
Heather is an independent developer with dozens of games under her belt. You may know her from her work as designer/writer on EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood, programmer on GENDERWRECKED: Post-Apocalyptic Genderpunk, or creator on any number of smaller projects, from GODKILLER BRIGADE TEN TRILLION to You Are A Wizard. You can follow her on Twitter here, or find her games catalog here.
Josie Brechner (she/they) - Composer, musician, sound designer
Josie is a composer, musician, and sound designer from Brooklyn, NY working under the name Visager. She's worked on a number of games before, including Blossom Tales: The Sleeping King, My Electric Heart, Gay Monster Kiss Club, and EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood. You can follow her on Twitter here or find her portfolio website here. 
Ryan Rose Aceae (they/them) - Character artist/designer
Ryro (aka Gendervamp) is an artist, writer, and game developer. They’re known for their work as the lead writer and character artist on GENDERWRECKED: Post-Apocalyptic Genderpunk, and for their short comic (Non)binary Star. Currently they are in development on their highly-anticipated dating sim, Gay Monster Kiss Club. You can follow them on Twitter here and find their work here.
Colin Horgan (he/they) - Animator, combat designer
Colin is a game developer and programmer. Most notably, they worked on Ectoplaza, Uncharted: Fortune Hunter, and the critically-acclaimed LUCAH: Born of a Dream. You can find their Twitter here.
Annette Benny (she/they) - Concept writer
Annette is a concept writer and artist from New Zealand. She debuted into the games scene with EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood. You can find her on Mastodon here.
Additionally, we have hired and will continue to hire a number of people to do smaller jobs on the project, to include as many different voices in the project as possible. At present, we've worked with:
Griffin B. Mabanglo (they/faer) - Sensitivity reader
Griffin is a sensitivity reader and artist living in the Pacific Northwest. They have been working professionally for over four years in a variety of mediums. Most recently, they have done sensitivity reading work on upcoming audio drama Internal Headache. You can find faer Twitter here and faer website here.
M Gewehr (they/them) - Additional recording and composition
M is a multi-instrumentalist, composer, and sound designer. Notably, they co-composed and performed on the EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood fight theme, CRASH QUEEN. You can find their Twitter here, and their Soundcloud here. 
Michaela Nachtigall (she/her) - Violinist 
Michaela is a composer, violinist, and Otamatonist from California. You may recognize her work from the trailer up above -- she was the violinist! You can find her Twitter here, and her YouTube channel here.
Zero Perkins (they/them) - Splash screen artist
Zero is an artist from California. You may recognize their work on EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood, as they did the main menu art for that game! They're returning to do more art for EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Bound By Ash. You can find their Twitter here, and an overview of their art here.
Dave Makes (they/them) - Splash screen artist
Dave is an artist, game developer, and programmer. Most notably, they are the creator of Pan Galactic Railway and Mixolumia. You can find their Twitter here, and their website here.
Princess Kavallines (she/her) - Postcard artist
Princess is an illustrator and visual designer. Notably, she was the designer for the colorful MEATPUNKS postcards, as you can see below! You can find her Twitter here, and her website here.
EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Bound By Ash is currently in a pre-alpha state. Think of it as a game with all of its bones but none of the meat yet: all the mechanics are implemented, all the aesthetic decisions have been made, all the story's been outlined. 
The primary thing we're missing is content, the meat to put on those bones. On the occasion that we succeed with this Kickstarter, we will spend the next year writing dialog, composing music, drawing character art, designing levels, and all the other little things that make a game like this shine. 
In order to create that content, we need funding. Funding through Kickstarter allows us to make this dream game, without forcing us to compromise our vision for publishers. MEATPUNKS is loudly queer, proudly antifascist, and strongly anti-authoritarian. With your help, we can keep it that way, while continuing the story in a new and bold direction.
Here's a rough estimate of where your money will be going, by percentage! The reason we call it "rough" is because certain parts can only be estimated at present; it's impossible for us to know how many rewards we'll be filling until y'all give us that number!
Still, we're very confident we'll be able to complete the game with this budget.
For your convenience, here's a table of every reward tier, and what you get along with each tier!
Let's talk a little more about those physical rewards, since we're personally VERY excited about them!
At the $40 level, in addition to previous rewards, you get a sick MEATPUNKS patch! Here's the design for it:
At the $50 level, in addition to previous rewards, you get a set of postcards of different locations in the world of EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER!
At the $75 level, you get the 16-page minicomic EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: GHOSTS. Here's a preview page to pique your interest!
At the $100 level, you get a signed postcard of your choice from the previous set...
And at the $150 level, you get a signed cassette tape containing the original soundtracks to EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Powered By Blood AND EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Bound By Ash! It's a two-for-one special! Here's a sneak peek at the concept art for it:
Then, we move on to the custom reward tiers!
At the $500 level, you get a Meatpunks-style character portrait based on yourself, a loved one, or an original character!
At the $1000 level, you get your very own MEATPUNKS-style custom fight theme in any genre of your choice (within reason)! The song will be 1.5 minutes long, you will get one round of revisions, and the composer will retain the right to distribute the final song.
Beyond that point, we have two tiers for people who want to give us several thousand dollars, which is kinda buck wild but we sure aren't disputing the idea.
At the $3,000 tier, we will work with you to design a character to be put in the game! This character will show up, have one or two lines, and then instantly die. Maybe a chandelier will fall on them. We'll work with you to give them a fitting death!
And finally, at the $10,000 tier, we will allow your in-game character to actually live throughout the main story! Many writers would say that inserting a complete unknown into an already-plotted story is a terrible idea, but we here are agents of chaos who don't know the meaning of fear.
EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Bound By Ash is a hugely personal project, and by supporting it you help us bring it to life. For supporting the project, or even sharing it, let us say from the bottom of our hearts: thank you so, so much.
<3
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: Bound By Ash is a game with a small, dedicated team. We fully plan on fulfilling our promise to the community and delivering a game experience that lives up to your expectations, but the nature of independent game development is sometimes chaotic, with unexpected pitfalls. With such a small team, were something bad to happen to one of the members, it could easily delay the release.

That said, one of the benefits of this being a sequel is that we've basically already made a game exactly like this, and we already know all of the challenges ahead of us. Additionally, much of the game's framework already exists from the first season, and while we plan on improving on nearly every aspect of the original game, doing so with an established framework is much easier and less risky.

Each person on the team is among the best at what they do, and the worst that could happen to the project (outside a serious emergency) is the project being delayed by a few months. We're a hardy team, and we are confident we will bring the game to completion in a timely manner.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: EXTREME MEATPUNKS FOREVER: BOUND BY ASH RELEASE DATE TRAILER
updates.update_content:
Hey, y'all!
Apologies for the slow update schedule. We've been playing things pretty close to our chest for a while, making sure the game looks/sounds/is the best it can be. Additionally, it's difficult to share progress on a story-based game without posting spoilers.

campaign.story:
THE TOWN OF FALLS GRAVE HAS A REAL BAD VAMPIRE PROBLEM...
Seriously, you can't even walk down a sinister looking alley without having your kidneys pulled out of your mouth these days...
THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS is a love letter to the horror movies of long ago. Like, not really long ago but long ago enough that nobody was asking questions like "Should we show that?" or "Do you think that's a bit TOO disgusting?" 
EVIL DEAD -- BAD TASTE / BRAINDEAD -- RE-ANIMATOR
We want to wash the set in the red stuff, make the audience shrink back in their seats at the sheer, unfiltered barf-fest that is THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS.
You want to see what's under there... We know you do!
When Katie Klein's best friend is murdered by a gang of greasy, no-good vampires, everyone in Falls Grave tells her "It's just something that happens here. Nothing we can do about it, the vamps have lived here longer than we have..."
Seeking revenge, she arms herself with a pointy stick and follows a creature of the night into it's lair... obviously this goes super well and she's about to meet an untimely end, when SUDDENLY a trio of roller derby girls appear and kick the absolute beans out of the monster.
THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS! 
An elite squad of Roller Derby girls who are on a mission to wipe every last vampire off the face of the Earth! Katie soon joins up, and... we can't tell you the rest! SPOILERS!!
THE STICKY STUFF...
We love to tell great stories, but we also want to really push the practical effects of THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS as far as we can. We're no strangers to getting our hands red, our first feature film "CHESTERSBERG" which is about to begin it's festival run (no rest for the wicked) is stuffed to the brim with effects, but we kept them all believable and realistic! If you want, you can check out the trailer for "CHESTERSBERG" below.
In Rollers, we want to crank the dial up to 11! If you've seen the pitch video, you've seen  a vampire have his junk kicked up out of his mouth - probably not medically possible, but absolutely hilarious! 
Producer Laura getting stuck in on the set of CHESTERSBERG
The High Stake Rollers will be played by REAL DERBY PLAYERS! A couple of the lead cast will be training over the six months leading to the shoot to ensure that they can skate well but skate safe! SAFETY IS SEXY!
Producer and co-writer Laura has skated for almost five years, and director Jamie has skated for six months but has spent the last five years as the official photographer for local team THE YORK MINXTERS, both of them either playing or snapping away at the British Roller Derby Championships around the country.
Laura (or Pandora Monium) has been playing Roller Derby since 2015.
The film will use the game! Now, derby can be quite complicated to anyone who doesn't know the sport so we'll be working on the fight scenes hard to make sure that they're exciting and dynamic, but also anyone who plays the game can knowingly nod as a blocker slams into a legal target zone of a vampire, or a jammer whips by a pivot to gain enough speed to take down a fleeing creature of the darkness! 
If you've ever had the absolute pleasure of watching Peter Jackson's BRAINDEAD, there's a fight scene in that film that's our launching point for choreography and in fact the inspiration for the tone of the film. 
If the campaign is successful, a part of the budget will be used to secure a space in York that we can use as a pre-production base where we can build the effects but also rehearse the fight scenes long before the cameras roll. Fighting on film is hard enough, but adding wheels into the mix is absolutely mad. We want to make sure that the violence is fast paced and hilarious, but also safe and responsible. In the run up to the filming, the space will be transformed into the Rollers HQ set. 
That absolute toe stomping track at the start of the pitch video is "Secret Fantasy" by  GlitterWølf . The guys will be joining the team to make the official soundtrack for the film.
You can check out more from GlitterWølf  on their awesome Bandcamp page.
On scoring duties we're incredibly happy to be once again collaborating with KYOTO DRAGON, the wizard behind the score to "I Am Tim Helsing" season 3 and of course "CHESTERSBERG". 
Get some KYOTO DRAGON into your ears over at the official Bandcamp page.
OUR LAST PROJECTS
Over the last eight years we have produced a huge amount of projects on the smallest of budgets.
"I AM TIM HELSING" is an award winning comedy horror series that has screened in festivals around the world. Three seasons made over the course of almost a decade, a real labour of love. We spent around £8000 in total over the years. You can watch all of the show on our YouTube channel.
"THE FINAL GIRL" was made on a budget of £300 a few years back, and is an example of how we can make things look great on a very tiny budget. The film has played in festivals around the world and is featured in a couple of anthologies and even books about the slasher genre.
THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS
So, why do we need all this money if we can make films with so little? Our last project, the feature film "CHESTERSBERG" had a total budget of £12500 and that was for a 91 minute film. 
The script for Rollers is 14 pages and we're looking to raise at the bottom end - £8000 which is around £7000 to £7250 once you remove crowdfunding fees and the cost of making t-shirts, DVDs etc... 
Of course, we want to raise more than £8000. We are looking to raise £11,000 (combined Kickstarter and outside investment) which will giver us the lovely round sum of £10,000 to make the short film with. 
Have a very lovely pie chart to break it all down for you.
This is a super simple breakdown of the budget, but it gives you an idea. We want to spend around £4000 on the effects (head moulds aren't cheap) to really get you deep in the guts. 
The pitch video on this campaign cost us £250 to make, including costume, location fees, food and drink to keep everyone alive and a good £40 on the Big Boy. 
Come on, you all know what we're talking about...
It all adds up brutally fast, but with the amazing and talented people we have working on this film we can make amazing things happen...
So this is something we'll talk about if the campaign goes wild and we smash through the initial target in the first week. Unlikely, but absolutely possibly!
The High Stake Rollers exists at the moment as a 15 minute (ish) short film BUT we do have a synopsis for a feature. Would we like to make a feature? Of course. OF COURSE! Some of our favourite films are currently appearing on BluRay thanks to ARROW and 88 FILMS. Such films as THE MUTILATOR or the supremely bonkers SORORITY BABES IN THE SLIMEBALL BOWL-O-RAMA. These films are the true inspiration behind THE HIGH STAKE ROLLERS, and if you haven't seen them you should hunt them down.
We'll announce these plans as part of a series of very ambitious stretch goals if the initial campaign skyrockets so watch this space!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
You're joining us about a quarter of the way through the project. We've got the script, we've cast a couple of main roles and the hype is strong. 

Historically, we've completed every project we have started and there's no reason why this one won't be the same. At the end of the line, we've always released the films either online or via some kind of physical media. 

The brief timeline is - 

AUGUST / SEPTEMBER : CROWDFUNDING

SEPTEMBER - DECEMBER : PRE-PRODUCTION / CAMERA TESTS / STORYBOARDING / WARDROBE / FIGHT REHEARSALS

JANUARY - FEB : LOCATION DRESSING AND ON SET REHEARSALS

MARCH : PRINCIPAL PHOTOGRAPHY

APRIL / MAY : EDITING AND PICK UPS

JUNE : FESTIVAL SUBMISSION AND ONLINE SCREENERS RELEASED

JULY - SEPTEMBER : CRAFTING DVDS AND BLURAYS, FINISHING PERKS

ALL REWARDS DELIVERED SEPTEMBER 2020.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi everyone! 
As things start to wake up in our part of the world I know some of you are keen to see this project start rolling. 
The last year-and-a-bit has been unbelievably difficult for everyone, we couldn't even begin to imagine that we would still be here back in February 2020 and as things return to the new normal we all have a lot of adjusting to do.

Hi everyone,

We had a little nudge from one of you put out an update on the project sooooo... here it is!

We're still waiting, like most of the world for things to return to normal. We're based in England which is still (after 1000 years) stuck in a very restrictive third national lockdown. We can't even meet one other person from another household unless we're out running a 5k.

Happy November to you all! 

Well, we thought we'd be bringing you some super cool news with this update but like the rest of the world we're just waiting... but we wanted to put out an update to reassure you all that as soon as we can make this film we will! Our original timeline would have seen the film currently (hopefully) playing in festivals with the premiere a few weeks ago - sadly we're nowhere near that.

News news news!
First up, the t-shirts have arrived and look AMAAAAZING! Thanks to Monster Press for doing such an amazing job on them. We're packing them up this week, if you're based near us we'll be dropping them off ourselves, if you're a little further away they'll be posted out early next week once the packing bags get to us before the weekend. Everyone will have their shirts by next weekend (overseas maaaaybe a little longer, it's a long swim.)

Yo! 
We sent out a poll to collect your sizes so we can make sure that we order the right stock. Check your emails, login to your Kickstarter account and make sure that we have your correct information.
We want to put the order in for them next Monday, so if you haven't put your details in by the weekend we can't promise that you'll get the right size. We're going to order a batch of them but please do make sure that you've popped in your current address and the size of the shirt you want!

What's going on with The High Stake Rollers?
Like the rest of the world, we find ourselves on hold. The plan was to be filming this month but in late February we started to wonder if that would be possible. By March, we knew that it was certainly not. The film is still 100% happening, we just don't know when.
Where have we been?
Take a look at the official HIGH STAKE ROLLERS t-shirt!

As we said in the last update, we're taking a small breather from the madness of making our first feature film and then diving headfirst into raising the funds for this little slice of fried madness but that doesn't mean that the project is 100% on a break...
Talks are happening about what we want to shoot the film with, what toys we need to get the right look, what sort of horrible special effects we want to do, and of course the story itself! Laura and I are heading off to NYC* on our honeymoon (during all this we planned, and indeed did a wedding!) after the Halloween madness settles, and then we'll be smashing face first into writing the most awesome script we can. We've plotted out the story, what sort of tale we can tell in around 15 minutes and once that's settled on it's time to barf up a first draft.

Less than 48 hours ago you all helped push us over the 100% target, making this film a reality!
You can still see the livestream on our YouTube channel. With 101 minutes to go we were at £7354 of the £8000 target, and for the first 60 minutes things didn't move at all. There were some worried faces in the room! Imagine if we were to come so close to the finish line only to fall short by less than a few hundred pounds.

YOU DID IT! YOU DAMN LUNATICS ACTUALLY DID IT!!
Proper update about what happens next on the way shortly, but for now know that we’re all incredibly thankful that you got behind this mad little film and made it happen.
Let’s slap some vampires around!!

campaign.story:
Check out our demo HERE!

It was a day like any other. You wake up, feel the sun on your face, wag your tail, and look forward to the day ahead.
Moments later, your life changes forever.
You don't know what to do. Your owner is nowhere to be found. You have no option but to go.
To chase.
To be lost.
To get back to what matters most: family.
This is the story of a lost dog trying to reunite with its owner, the emotional roller coaster of a grand adventure in pursuit of the most important thing in life.


We all grew up with animal stories. From films about overcoming obstacles to ancient stories and motifs about animals that shaped the course of history, animal journeys are part of our collective cultural DNA. And yet, we still haven't had the animal game!
That's what we're making.
DOGGONE is a game about a lost dog trying to find its way back home, inspired by the animal movies we all grew up with. 
From the bottom of our hearts, we believe that this game needs to exist - and that's where we need your help!
We want to bring DOGGONE to life as an episodic game, and your pledge would help us create part one. This episodic structure gets the game into your hands sooner rather than later and helps us generate additional revenue to fund the rest of development. We'll discuss that in further detail below - for now, here's more on the game!


DOGGONE is a fully-fledged dog experience. The core gameplay revolves around platforming and puzzle solving, reminiscent of Playdead's INSIDE. 
On top of that, we're adding in "dog things" because... well, you're a dog and sometimes you need to do dog things!
For example, you'll be able to "sniff out" pathways and hidden items.
Other abilities include smell-o-vision to guide you in the right direction, barking, and rolling around (for no reason other than you are a dog).
Our story will take the dog through a roller coaster ride of environments, encounters, and excitement. Happy ending, we promise! It wouldn't be a good story without bumps along the way, but in the end we want to bring you that warm and fuzzy feeling you signed up for.
While you're on this journey, we're meticulously crafting the game to feel like a fully-imagined 3D space through unique camerawork. Think of the camera as a director framing your journey, moving it to just the right place every step of the way.
Remember that screenshot from earlier? Here's how that shot is introduced!
Our visual direction is something we're very proud of, so let's discuss that some more!


From the beginning, we wanted this adventure to be aesthetically breathtaking. Our game is heavily inspired by the works of Eyvind Earle, who made his name as a background artist on Disney’s Sleeping Beauty (1959).  
The art team experimented with many aspects of the Eyvind Earle style, while keeping the same core tenets of vibrant colors and sharp edges. Some trees had very fantastic elements like angular branches and bush-like leaves!
As we narrowed things down and worked hard on the style, we created more detailed ideas of how spaces could look. This led us to the overarching visual style you see today!
Our art director Abdullah has expertly guided our talented art team in the creation of this visual style, and we're very excited to continue bringing this world to life.


Here's a quick breakdown of how the campaign funds will be used.

There is a ~10% "safety net" incorporated into this budget accounting for if we missed something in our planning process. If everything goes according to plan and that budget doesn't need to be used for that purpose, it'll go back into the project to create more content in the form of an additional level.
We also mentioned earlier that this project is going to be episodic, and we wanted to give you an idea of where that will take us. Here's a look at our tentative roadmap for the game.


This campaign will fund Episode I, the major first steps of our dog's journey. You'll experience the inciting event that sets our hero on their adventure, and traverse the first one third (roughly) of our narrative.
The journey won't stop there, though. After completing your first playthrough of this episode, you'll unlock Challenge Mode! This will offer additional gameplay depth and replayability options, with new challenges being available at a regular cadence between episodes. Right now, we envision that as meaning weekly and monthly challenges.
Your first playthrough will allow you to experience the dog's journey the way we narratively intended. Challenge Mode gives you the option to re-experience the adventure with different modifiers and twists! Think of the recent Hitman games and how you could keep coming back.
Completing these challenges will provide rewards, and these rewards will carry over into the other episodes. We're not saying you might get silly costumes and hats, but... ;)
We'll use sales from Episode I to create the remaining episodes (aiming for Summer and Fall 2020, respectively) culminating in a release of the full package at the very end of that timeline.


Animal stories are universal across cultures, and we're living that ethos: Raconteur Games is made up of talented folks from all over the world!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Games are risky, no matter what they are or who is making them. Our team is ready to hit the ground running if we're funded, and every single person on our team has shipped at least one commercial game before. It's not our first rodeo -- we have set a clear scope for what we're going to create. The biggest challenge will be staying within that scope to finish on time. The ~10% extra safety net will account for any extra time we have to spend making the game polished and ready for you to play, and if it turns out we didn't need it, it'll go back into the game to create an additional level. We have a vision, and we think we'll be able to bring it to you within the time and budget we provided.

campaign.story:
We have stretch goals now!


Calico is a day-in-the-life community sim game where you are given an important and adorable task: rebuild the town’s cat café and fill it with cute and cuddly creatures! You will journey to a small village filled with magical girls and other fantastical friends, where you are placed in charge of a run down cat café. Build up your café by filling it with cute furniture, fun decorations, yummy pastries, and get it bustling with animals again!
In Calico, you play as a sweet magical cutie. There are two playable characters to choose from: Heartgirl and Flowergirl! 
 Which Platforms?
Calico will release on PC and Mac (steam included), Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and PlayStation 4~

Unlike its inspirations, such as Harvest Moon and Animal Crossing, there are no negative consequences.  Animals will not die, the shop will not close, and the crops will not rot.  Players are free to explore the joy of a heavily stylized world full of cuddly critters. 
Calico is meant to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. The gameplay reflects that with a laid back, low stress creative environment to explore and play in.
Explore the village to find cats and other animals, including raccoons, deer, dogs, turtles, red pandas, foxes, and many, many more cuties!
The player will encounter many animals in the world of Calico. Once befriended, you can name them, add them to your party, or send them to their new home at the café. Animals in your party will follow you everywhere you go and listen to your commands. The animals in your cafe will relax and play with any customers that pop in for a visit.
 All animals are interactive!
Along with adding animals to your party, Interact with cats and other animals by petting and playing! Some of the animal interactions in Calico will include playing with toys, dancing, cuddling, petting, carrying, lounging with, and pampering. There will even be special features, like placing animals on your head! Special creatures like koi fish will be able to be fed, and the birds would love to be given seeds!  
 We have big plans for the animals' personalities. Their AI will include things like:   
Happiness, trust, and energy levels  
How active, lazy, or hungry they are  
How close they like to be to the player  
Do they like being picked up?
Do they listen to player commands? 
What other animals do they like as friends  
What’s their favorite toy?
Unique actions exclusive to specific animals And more!
For the “Your pet in the game” Kickstarter tiers, we will ask you to describe your pet’s personality and quirks so that their in-game version will properly capture their spirit! 
Calico takes place on a star-shaped island with 6 different environmental areas. In the middle is a heart shaped town where your café resides!
Calico is a cat café in the middle of a small heart shaped town. For those unaware, a cat café is a café that includes cats that can be watched and played with. But animal cafés are not limited to cats. Some areas have bunny cafés, owl cafés, or even raccoon cafés!
This café is open to all animals, and needs your care to become a welcoming cafe again!
Decoration
 Your task in Calico is to bring the town's café back to life again. This isn’t just achieved by bringing in cats and animals alone, however – you can also decorate your café with furniture and toys! We will have a full system that allows you to collect and arrange furniture, decorations, and toys. Some furniture is for the café’s human visitors, while other furniture is meant for your animal friends (like cat trees, scratching posts, and dog beds, to name a few options!). 
Yummy drinks and dessert in the café
 Create a wonderful café by making yummy bakes goods and drinks for the townspeople! We will have a system in which you can create and display pastries for sale in the café display cases, as well as create a drink menu. Some of the pastries and drinks will be customizable. For instance, the macaroons will have a surface on which you can paint designs~ 

 Currency System
While having goods on display in the town, residents of the town will be able to come by and purchase your goods and hang out in the café. This means you will gradually start making money. Things that you will be able to use money for include more furniture and decorations for your cafe, more toys for your animals, more available foods and drinks to make, and shopping around town! (Note: this is entirely optional!)
 In town will be multiple shops, including the potion shop. Autumn runs the potion shop at the top of the hill, in a giant moss terrarium. Give her a visit to get potions that can alter animals and the game around you! 
 We wanted there to be no limits to how you could find happiness in Calico. Magic potions are a system that allow us to break the rules of what is possible and to find what would be most fun. 
Here’s a taste of what’s to come: the More-to-pet Potion allows the player to magically turn a single animal giant-sized! You can hang out with a giant animal, or even ride a giant cat! 
Or a red panda!

About Funds
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise enough money that both Andrew and Kells can work on the game full time for the next year and a half. That is where most of the money will go, as we cover most of the bases. The other amounts will go to the usual legal requirements/ fees/ safety net, and skills we can't cover. The chart below shows the distribution of our budget!

More About Us!
Calico is being created by CatBean Games, a two person studio in Seattle, WA. 
Kells and Andrew at a wolf sanctuary makin' friends!
Kells is an artist and community manager from both New York City and Minnesota, and is working on most of the art and design of the game. 
Andrew is a programmer from Ohio who is working on most of the Unity Development and technical design for Calico
We also have wonderful contributors who are helping us!
Rob - Rob is our amazing potion asset creator, who will be helping us flesh out our inventory of assets so that players will have a lot to choose from!
Diego - Diego is an animator who has been helping bring our magical girls to life! He creates incredible, full of life animations!
Plum - Plum is our lovely sound designer, who will help add that good meow content to Calico.
Ninichi - Ninichi is our music magician for Calico! She is a UK-based composer for games, film & media. Her credits include: Shakey’s Escape, Cyclocube & Power Pool Slam. She loves music, playing games & cute & colourful things!
We Also Have A Guest Contributor!
Emi Evans, most notable for her performances in the soundtracks for the NieR series, Dark Souls, and Ace Combat: Assault Horizon will be contributing to a bonus music track for Calico! We are So excited to be working with her!
Thank you so much for reading this far! Feel free to ask us ANY questions, or just chat with us and any of the links below~
Discord
Twitter
Facebook
Mailing list
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far and risks and challenges go, we're playing it pretty safe. All of the features that we've mentioned above are things we know we can do, it'll just take a lot of time, and a lot of hard work! We know that on your end, you may be hesitant to back a studio on their first official game. If you do end up putting your trust in us, I can say honestly that we will try our absolute best to make sure we make you proud. We plan to be transparent and open about our progress along the way. We've already had a lot of fun engaging with the community by showing development so far!

Thank you for your time and consideration~ 
-CatBean Games

updates.update_content:
Hello friends! 

Thank you all so much for being patient with us through launch. We knew when we picked a December launch that there would be some difficulties, but we never imagined how much the holidays and the pandemic slow down would impact certain aspects of launching out of our control. You have all been so incredibly supportive and understanding, and we're beyond happy to see how much people have been enjoying the game. 💖

updates.update_userinfo: Post-Launch update, patches, and key updates!
updates.update_content:
Hello friends! It has now been almost one week since we launched! 💖

First off, I would like to thank you all for your incredible patience and support. Even though it is absolutely wonderful the huge amount of support and attention we've gotten since launch, that means our tiny 2 person team has had to handle. Since Andrew is handling the bug fix patches, that means that I'm (Kells) the only one fielding hundreds of messages across many different platforms, more emails and messages than I've ever gotten in my life! 😱 I'm working my hardest to plow through and respond to everyone I can as quickly as possible.

Hey friends! We have an unfortunate but hopeful announcement to make today. 

We’re officially delaying the release of Calico. 

Some of you may be unsurprised to hear this given that we were meant to release in October, and we hadn’t made any announcements about a specific date recently. Others may be unsurprised because 2020 has truly left no one untouched with its global complications and difficulty. Sadly, every single last person working on our game, including Andrew and I (Kells) have been directly affected by this year’s events in significant ways, and some that are tragic.

The hopeful section of this announcement is that we don’t expect this delay to be long at all! We thankfully aren’t too behind schedule, but just enough to make an October release impossible without sacrificing both quality and health.

Hello friends!
We're still working hard making Calico! Not much to update you on at this moment, we are very excited to be in some upcoming showcases in the Fall, but you'll hear more about that when we can publicly announce them! 
Reminder to send in your design tier designs!

Hello friends, before I start with some exciting updates I want to mention current events. Lots of people excited about Calico are also excited about the diverse representation in both our game and our growing team. I want to express how important it is for us to direct that passion onto systemic issues like police brutality that impact Black people generation after generation. Incremental change is not enough, we need to do more. Kickstarter is an incredibly generous community, and I know good things can come from here. Please check out this website for ways to help.

GEL is a manga inspired sci-fi/ fantasy, like Mad Max meets Lord of the Rings.  
GEL tells a brutal and kick ass tale of survival and (re)connecting with the world and people around you. After the Earth suffers a cataclysm of biblical proportions, humans are nearly extinct and are no longer at the top of the food chain. There are monsters around every corner- in the skies, underground, behind your back and in your nightmares!  
This Kickstarter is to help fund the illustration and printing of issues 4, 5 and 6. The players are on the board and the game is a foot! Sera and Satoshi fight to stay alive on their way to The Rose. Meanwhile, the Rose's leader The Armless is dealing with his own troubles from within the city! Will Satoshi and Sera make it to The Rose? Will there be anything left by the time they get there?! 
(M/Mature readers- contains coarse language and violence)
The following excerpt is from GEL #4: 
Sera was forged in the fires of the apocalypse and hardened by the world around her. After years alone, she makes her way towards a city where peace and civilization are being reborn. But, is Sera ready to live amongst her own kind again?
The Armless is the guardian of The Rose and a symbol of worship to the city’s people. The Rose becomes increasingly unsafe as people start to question their leader’s methods of protection from threats both inside and outside of the community.
A demoness and queen of the horde. She’s a simple creature… kill everything!
Issues #1-3 are also available for sale individually at https://andrewkwanart.bigcartel.com/
The bulk of your funding is going to printing the books and shipping (postage and shipping materials). I want to make sure your rewards get to you safely and minimize wait time! Everything else is split among reward production, materials and Kickstarter fees. 
 Issue 4 and 5 are 22 pages long and issue 6 is 24 pages long!  
See THIS POST on how to add on items to your pledge! 
Bonus Art Giveaway
Since this campaign and #inktober were going on at the same time, I figured that I would give my sketches to YOU! All backers are eligible- after the campaign and all the backers are locked in, I'll post a video of me picking 14 random numbers that will correspond with your backer numbers in an update and sketches will be arbitrarily given to the winners.
Andrew Sebastian Kwan is a professional artist/ writer from Toronto, Canada and the creator of GEL. Besides his creator-owned work, Andrew has designed clothes for Parks Canada Original as well as character designs for the Steam game Move or Die. Andrew also worked on the Canadian animated series Total Drama Island and also creates alternative movie posters which have been featured in The New York Times. Follow him on instagram @the.Andrewkwan

This post has been a long time coming. I hope everyone is have a good start to 2020! I wanted to post something about finishing GEL and how it felt like a great accomplishment and hoping everyone enjoyed the series- I also wanted to have new things to show as well. I'm finally ready to share what I've been working on that might be interesting!
I am creating a new book that takes place far in the future after the events of GEL called NEO:BLOSSOMS! I don't have a set date on when I might be crowdfunding, but I can tell you what I want it to be and what it's about! NEO:BLOSSOMS will NOT be released as single issue comics, but a graphic novel/artbook hybrid that uses comics, illustrations, concept art and storyboards to tell a singular story! I want to do something special, unique, fun and include types of art that I'd be really interested in seeing from creators.

campaign.story:
Thank you to those who backed! Follow our socials and sign up for our newsletter to keep updated on Calico! We did not reach our funding goal this time, but we have plans moving forward to continue working on the game and looking for funding. This cuddly kitty dream is not going away any time soon. ❤️
Mailing list
Twitter
Facebook
Calico has a playable prototype! Though very basic, this will hopefully show you our vision for Calico. (windows only for now)
Prototype Demo Download
Calico is a day-in-the-life community-sim where you move to a town of magical girls and are given a harrowing yet adorable task; Make the town’s cat café active and full of cuddly creatures again! You will journey to a small village of Magical Girls and other fantastical friends to fix up the cat cafe, as well as fill it with furniture, decorations, yummy pastries and most importantly CATS!
You Can Look Over Our Dev Journey Here!
Calico is a game meant to make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside. The gameplay reflects that with a laid back, low stress creative environment to explore and play in.
Explore the village to find cats and other animals, including raccoons, deer, dogs, turtles, red pandas, foxes, and many, many more cuties!
The player will encounter many animals in the world of Calico, and once you befriend them you can name them, then add them to your party or send them to their new home at the cafe. The animals in your party will follow you everywhere you go and listen to your commands. The animals in your cafe will relax and play with any customers that pop in for a visit.
Interact with cats and other animals by petting and playing, all animals are interactive!
 Interactions will include playing with toys, dancing, cuddling, petting, carrying, lounging with and pampering! There will also be features like being able to put the animals on your head. Special creatures, like Koi fish will be able to be fed, and I'm sure the birds would love some seeds!
We have big plans for the animals' personalities. Their AI will include things like:   
Happiness, trust, and energy levels  
How active, lazy, or hungry they are  
How close they like to be to the player  
Do they like being picked up  
Do they listen to player commands  
What other animals do they like as friends  
What’s their favorite toy  
Unique actions exclusive to specific animals And more!
For the “Your pet in the game” Kickstarter tiers, we will ask you to describe your pet’s personality and quirks so that their in-game version will properly capture their spirit!

Calico is a cat café in the middle of town. For those unaware, a cat café is a café that includes cats that can be watched and played with. But animal cafés are not limited to cats. Some areas have bunny cafés, owl cafés, or even raccoon cafés!
Decoration
Your task in Calico is to bring the town's café back to life again. Along with bringing cats and animals in, as mentioned in the animal sections, you can also decorate your cafe with furniture and toys! We will have a full system allowing you to collect and arrange furniture, decorations, and toys. Some of the furniture will be for people visiting the cafe, and some will be cat and animal furniture like Cat trees, scratching posts, and dog beds.
Yummy drinks and dessert in the café
Along with creating a nice place for the residents and animals of the town to hang out, you can also serve them yummy bakes goods and drinks! We will have a system in which you can create and display pastries for sale in the café display cases, as well as create a drink menu. Some of the pastries and drinks will be customizable. For instance, the macaroons will have a surface in which you can paint designs!
Currency System
While having goods on display in the town, residents of the town will be able to come by and purchase your goods and hang out in the café. This means you will gradually start making money. Things that you will be able to use money for include more furniture and decorations for your cafe, more toys for your animals, more available foods and drinks to make, and shopping around town!
In town will be multiple shops, including the potion shop. Autumn runs the potion shop at the top of the hill, in a giant wet plant terrarium. In the full game, give her a visit to get potions that can alter animals and the game around you!
Autumn's Potion Shop
We wanted there to be no limits to how you could find happiness in Calico. Magic potions are a system that allow us to break the rules of what is possible and to find what would be most fun. 
More-to-pet Potion is just one example of many available potions!
More-to-pet Potion allows the player to pick an animal to grow to a larger size. You can hang out with a giant animal, or even ride a giant cat!
In Calico, you play as a sweet magical cutie. There are two playable characters to choose from, Heartgirl and Flowergirl!
We even have this cute  demo animation from Diego!
Kiva - Town Mayor
Kiva is the friendly magical girl mayor of our town! She is SUPER excited for the cat café to open again. She is dedicated to keeping the people of the town as happy as possible. She also emanates ẗ̟̭͍̬̯͕̦͔͔͗̿̓͂͜ḩ̴̧̤̞̤͇͖̘̓̊̈̆͞ę̸̙̩̹̟͛̆̆̄̽̈̕͜ v̵͍̱͕̣͈́̈́̈͆̄͑̀͗͑͟͢͟͢͞ͅo̵̧̡̩̮͈͖̦͆̍̏͌̉̍̀͟͟͞ḯ̵̛̖̰̥̘̫̺͉̃̊̂̊̄͢͡ḑ͙͈͔̟͇̖͐͊͑͊̔̇̓̐͘, out of her arms and legs, but she doesn't want you to worry about that.
Autumn - Potion Shop Owner
Autumn owns the potion shop at the top of the hill. Her appearance is due to her accidentally spilling a potion on herself, which made her part cat. She seems to not mind much though. She is very proud of her well taken care of terrarium home.
Oliver - Travelling merchant
Oliver is a mysterious stray cat that wanders from village to village. Due to this, you know almost nothing about him, but the good part is that he brings cool items from out of town. He seems to like flowers.
Lila - Resident
Lila, another magical girl lives near you. She is very sweet and always smells of roses. She's in charge of the flowers around town.
Ash - Resident
Ash is a skilled, yet laid-back magic user. They like to chat with Autumn about potions, and have even used potions to create some of their tattoos.
Elise - Resident
Elise is another Resident. She is an experienced witch who may have access to some special potions. You'll have to befriend her to learn more.
 Many more residents and characters to come!
Which Platforms?
We guarantee PC and Mac. Beyond that, we have plans to develop for multiple other platforms including Nintendo Switch and Xbox One, but we can't give a guarantee until we can apply and get approval.
About Funds
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise enough money that both Andrew and Kells can work on the game full time for the next year and a half. That is where most of the money will go, as we cover most of the bases. The other amounts will go to the usual legal requirements/ fees/ safety net, and skills we can't cover. The chart below shows the distribution of our budget!
Rewards
Every reward over $15 USD gets you a copy of the game, Steam or DRM free PC/Mac!
Every reward above $20 USD get's you access to the alpha/ beta secret section of our Discord! You will get to have one of the first looks at new features added to the game, or access to test builds that come out!
***With $25 you get the Otters Holding Hands rewards, you get two copies of the game, and two invites to the secret discord!
Every reward above $40 gets you the Mystical Magical Calico Zine! (short form paperback comic) This Zine will focus on Heartgirl and Flowergirl and be illustrated by our lead artist, Kells who's most notable comic is Dont Seek The Void.
The next tiers all have the previous rewards, with one special reward added on!
*new* Become A Magical Person 2D Version! $60 USD
In this rewards, you get all of the previous bundle rewards, along with a colored sketch of you as a magical person (magical girl/boy/enby, witch, mysterious catboy, or any other sort of magical humanoid) illustrated by Calico's lead artist, Kells!
Design a Pet Toy! $100
Design a pet toy for animals to use in game! This can be a toy for any animal, like a cat, dog or rabbit. Maybe your pet's favorite toy?
  Potion Master $150
It's time for you to become a full magic user! Design a potion for use in the game, including sparkle power, swooshiness, color, magic ability, bottle appearance, and other factors!
Your Pet In The Game! ($200 early bird, $400 Basic)
At this reward tier, you will be able to either put one of your lovely pets in the game, or make up an animal! This animal of any non-human species, will appear in town, like other animals, but it will also be pre-named!
Fuzzy Fluffy Family $800 USD
For this reward, not only do you get to put one pet in the game (real or imagined), but we will but your whole family of pets (up to three) in the game! These animals of any non-human species, will appear in town, like other animals, but they will also be pre-named! Along with that, Kells, Calico's lead artist will draw a portrait of you, up to 3 pets, and up to one other person.
Become A Magical Person ⭐($1000 early bird, 1500 basic)
Do a magical transformation sequence and become the being of magic you've always wanted to be! For this reward, we will work with you on making a character in the game, they can be a witch, magical girl/boy/enby, or any other special human! It can be based on you, or entirely separate.
More About Us!
Calico is being created by CatBean Games, a two person studio in Seattle, WA. 
Kells is an artist and community manager from both New York City and Minnesota that was the first creator of Calico and is working on most of the art, as well as design.
Andrew is a programmer from Ohio who is working on most of the Unity Development and technical design.
We also have wonderful contributors who are helping us!
Rob - Rob is our amazing potion asset creator, he will be helping us flesh out our inventory of assets so that players will have a lot to choose from!
Diego - Diego is an animator who has been helping bring our magical girls to life! He creates incredible, full of life animations!
Ninichi - Ninichi is our music magician for Calico! She is a UK-based composer for games, film & media. Her credits include: Shakey’s Escape, Cyclocube & Power Pool Slam. She loves music, playing games & cute & colourful things!
We Also Have A Guest Contributor!
Emi Evans, most notable for her performances in the soundtracks for the NieR series, Dark Souls, and Ace Combat: Assault Horizon will be contributing to a bonus music track for Calico! We are So excited to be working with her! 
Further info, merchandise, and press kit at 
http://calicogame.com/
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As far and risks and challenges go, we're playing it pretty safe. All of the features that we've mentioned above are things we know we can do, it'll just take a lot of time, and a lot of hard work! We know that on your end, you may be hesitant to back a studio on its first game. If you do end up putting your trust in us, I can say honestly that we will try our absolute best to make sure we make you proud. We plan to be transparent and open about our progress along the way. We've already had a lot of fun engaging with the community by showing development so far!

Thank you for your time and consideration~
-CatBean Games

CLICK HERE! More information about these stretch goals can be found in this update post! 
The Contigo Team decided on these stretch goals by discussing what elements of the game our community wants to see more of and what high value additional content we can add. All of these stretch goals will be ready and available at launch for you to enjoy and we feel they will contribute greatly to the overall quality of the game experience. 
  If we somehow surpass these goals, we have some additional crazy ideas for future stretch goals we'll announce at a later date! Again, thank you all for your overwhelming support! We are humbled and so grateful!
StarCrossed is an action arcade game with a magical girl aesthetic and a cooperative twist, coming to PC, Mac, and Linux systems in early 2019. Join our cast of 5 space-faring heroes as they travel from planet to planet, working together to strengthen their bond and defeat a looming evil that threatens the galaxy! 
Cast of 5 playable characters to choose from, each with their own ultimate ability!
Designed from the ground up for 2 player local co-op! (can play solo!)
Xbox and PS4 controller support!
Arcade mode with global high score leaderboard!
Story mode featuring visual novel style dialogue scenes and an epic quest!
Original soundtrack!
Fast paced arcade style action for two players! In space!
StarCrossed is being developed by Contigo Games, an independent games studio dedicated to creating compelling multiplayer experiences. Our team has been working on this game for about 2 years and we've been paying all expenses out of pocket. We're turning to Kickstarter and our community for financial support for outreach and marketing so we can ensure a smooth and successful launch! We also hope to bring the game to console shortly after our PC release, which will only be possible with your support! The team is currently targeting Xbox One and Switch for future releases. Thank you!
StarCrossed is an action arcade game with a cooperative twist. It's similar to a classic arcade space shooter except your only weapon is the star bouncing between you and your partner. Our mission is to provide an experience that focuses on the importance of collaboration, showcased by the two-player cooperative gameplay. Timing and teamwork are key! 
StarCrossed has two main mechanics, Flying and Starboosting! The only way to destroy an enemy is by hitting them with the star that is bouncing between both players. Since the star always returns to you, your position grants you full control over its path… If you can coordinate with your partner.
When the star is near you can Starboost with a well timed button press, giving it a burst of speed and increasing the Sync Level between you and your partner. Represented by the bars on the bottom of the screen, your Sync Level controls the speed of the star as well as your score multiplier. Every successful Starboost increases your sync, but each miss takes some away. 
Starboost in sync with your partner for more power!
When things get challenging, a Dash is available to get you out of a bad situation. Sometimes all you need is a few frames of invincibility and a burst of speed to stay alive… but sometimes you need more.
If you and your partner can keep your Sync Level up you will begin to charge your Ultimate ability. This is a flashy and powerful attack unique to the character you choose that can be saved until you need it most! 
A well timed ultimate can make a big difference!
Can you stay in sync with your partner to destroy the enemies that want to keep you at bay? Join our cast of 5 space-faring heroes as they travel from planet to planet, working together to strengthen their bond and defeat a looming evil that threatens the galaxy!
The Nova Galaxy is an empire of unified peoples, physically pulled and held together through time and space with the power of the Harmony Crystal. Though it is constantly protected by the royal family, in past times of crisis the Harmony Crystal has anointed five heroes to defend it from harm and thus keep the galaxy unified. StarCrossed is the story of a new time of crisis and the new heroes chosen to fight. 
We don't want to give away too much of the plot! StarCrossed's Story Mode is currently in development and features curated cooperative challenges including enemy waves, boss fights, and visual novel style cutscenes telling the story of our heroes and their journey. 
Dialogue cutscenes are currently in development and feature fully illustrated character portraits!
StarCrossed is about the squad's stories, but that doesn’t mean it won’t challenge you! Using a mix of hand created challenges and procedural enemy generation, StarCrossed scales to the challenge you are looking for. Giving you the option to focus on the story or to chase a world record score.
Some of us are score chasers too, which is why we have an Endless Arcade Mode as well that makes heavy use of our procedural enemy system to give you a challenge beyond the story mode that you can share how long you and your partner can last on a Global Leaderboard.
StarCrossed has been designed from the ground up as a local co-op game, but is also playable by one person.
StarCrossed also features an original soundtrack composed by Alex Parrish. Here's a sample of the playful, upbeat tunes you can expect to hear in the finished game. Click below to listen!
StarCrossed is heavily inspired by classic mahou shoujo ("Magical Girl") media, think "Sailor Moon" or "Tokyo Mew Mew". Our team loves the premise of a ragtag group of strangers from different backgrounds coming together for a common cause and we borrowed our favorite character tropes and inspirations to create our cast. 
Through the game, players are able to choose which two characters are used in gameplay. The two characters collaborate and work together, strengthening their understanding of one another and the bond between them. We're excited for players to explore the game's Story Mode with different combinations of characters, resulting in unique dialogue exchanges and memories! Ultimately, we hope you love our characters as much as we do! 
Physical Rewards include character pins & sticker sheet featuring cute art of the StarCrossed characters!
The story of Contigo Games is a story of four friends who wanted to stay close even when life pulled them geographically far away. Francesca, Dillon, Benny, and Mike founded Contigo Games in 2016 in Massachusetts, USA to work on StarCrossed. As personal obligations forced us to move apart, Contigo continued existing as a remote team. We've been working on StarCrossed for a little over 2 years now, but our goal remains the same as it was on day 1; to create a game about cooperation and friendship which brings players together the same way that creating it has kept us together.
StarCrossed began as a 3-hour game jam project (You made a game in 3 hours???  Yes, it was difficult and we don't recommend it!). We began showing our tiny project to friends, peers, and at local developer meet ups. Although it was hardly a game at the time, the reaction was overwhelmingly positive and our dreams for what this game could become starting growing wildly. Since then we've formed a company, shown demos of StarCrossed at large scale events like PAX East and Pixelpop Festival, and made a game that we're truly proud of! It's been a long and amazing journey and we're excited to finally release the game in to the world. 
We are a game studio that values the input and feedback from our community. If you've been following the game for a while, we appreciate your support more than you know. If you're just joining us now, welcome! We hope you'll stick around and be a part of our community.
Francesca Carletto-Leon (@ceschiii) is an experienced independent game developer and educator who has been with StarCrossed since the beginning. She wears many hats and is our producer, narrative designer, and 3D artist. Her favorite Sailor Scout is Sailor Jupiter.
Dillon DeSimone (@gunpuncher) was brought on after the original prototype. Instantly sold on the promising aesthetic of the game, Dillon locked in as the lead artist. He's animated all the characters and enemies, and focused on designing a fun, effective UI! 
Michael Flood (@MikeFlewd) was introduced to the project shortly after the initial prototype and was immediately hooked on StarCrossed’s unique mechanic. Mike is the gameplay designer and programmer making StarCrossed both fun and fair for all players! 
Benjamin Peake (@BennyPeake) is an experienced software engineer and one of the original prototypers. He has been hooked since the beginning and has been responsible for making many of the inner gears of StarCrossed turn.
Oriana Carletto (@milkliem) was brought on to the team because of her skill in designing captivating characters. She is responsible for our 2D character art and illustrations which appear in Story Mode.
Alex Parrish (@PearlPixel) is a composer and musician responsible for creating StarCrossed's sound track. Please check out her amazing work here!
Renzo G. Heredia (@RenzoGHeredia) is a longtime friend and talented sound designer who is handling our sound effects and soundscape. His previous credits include work at Harmonix and Sony Santa Monica Studio.
We decided to come to Kickstarter because we love the sense of support and community it invokes. StarCrossed started off largely as a passion project and we've been paying all expenses out of pocket. This includes development costs, cost of living for our team, traveling to festivals and conventions, and marketing costs. We're turning to Kickstarter and our community for financial support for our launch so we can ensure adequate outreach and find audiences that we know will love our game! 
Here's a breakdown of exactly where your money is going. The majority of funds will go towards marketing the game and outreach. After Kickstarter fees (10%) and Kickstarter rewards fulfillment (15%), the remaining funds will go towards certification on consoles and 15% of our raised money will go directly to our lovely contractors, so that StarCrossed can feature more full-color illustrations, music, and sound effects. We hope to bring the game to console shortly after our PC release, which will only be possible with your support! Our team is currently targeting Xbox One and Switch for future releases and this Kickstarter will help support our team through the certification process. Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign, and we hope you'll consider contributing!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
StarCrossed is almost finished and our team is confident we'll be able to release the full game on our expected launch date. We know the risks that come with unfinished projects, and we've been careful to assess our capabilities and the needed timeframe. We also have a number of experienced mentors who are advising us through both the crowdfunding and development process.

We've always been a very transparent team, and we plan to maintain high levels of communication with our backers during the final push to launch the game. If something unexpected does happen, we believe our community has the right to be in the know.

campaign.story:
Hello! My name is Toril Orlesky and I’m the creator of Hotblood! and Hotblood: ZARCO, a free-to-read webcomic series about centaurs in the American Old West. The initial production of ZARCO was funded by my first Kickstarter, and I've posted it online since January 2017. With your help, I want to bring the story to print as a full-color graphic novel!
☼ NEW $40,000 STRETCH GOAL: 『 Spike in a Rail 』☼
An offline graphic novella .PDF download ➸ exclusive to this Kickstarter campaign. It will be black and white, approximately 40 pages, rated R16+ for canon-typical content... a story from 1875 about James Rook, Asa Langley, and the Bonneville Salt Flats. As you can see, the style will be different from the previous comics. Every backer will receive a download link in their inbox!
 ZARCO is the indirect sequel to Hotblood!. Set nine years later, it follows Sheriff Rafael Zarco of Sonoma County, California, and his encounter with wanted criminal James “Red” Rook. It's about grief, crime that pays, and the Pacific coast. The main story is rated R16+ for mature themes, language, and violence. The final scene will be posted online after the Kickstarter.
You can read ZARCO here!
The aim of this Kickstarter is to print all of ZARCO in one volume. In addition to the existing comic that’s available for free online, the print edition of ZARCO will contain cleaned up art, revised text, sketches and other behind-the-scenes material. I will also be releasing an exclusive R18+ .PDF with sketches and scenes that were previously cut from the public version of the story. 
On top of all that, this is another chance to order the Hotblood! Omnibus Edition and Foundry, the companion art book to the world of Western centaurs.
☼ ZARCO: THE GRAPHIC NOVEL
☼ R18+ .PDF (ADULTS ONLY!)
☼ HOTBLOOD! OMNIBUS EDITION
☼ FOUNDRY: HOTBLOOD! MATERIALS BOOK
☼ SIGNED BOOKPLATES (LIMITED) A slick bookplate sticker, signed by me, to put in your book (or anywhere else)!
☼ TRADITIONAL SKETCH COMMISSIONS (LIMITED) An original 5x7" B&W ink + marker sketch of a Hotblood! character of your choice!
☼ DIGITAL COMMISSIONS (LIMITED) A hi-res, full-color drawing of yourself or your original character as a centaur!
The goal of $8,000 has been estimated based on quotes for printing the books as well as freight shipping and fulfillment and Kickstarter’s 10% cut. Fulfillment will be handled by Blackbox!
THANKS A MILLION !!

This is my second Kickstarter campaign and the thirteenth (lucky!) book I've produced since 2014.
